item.title: Environmental pollution remains big challenge for Hà Nội

item.title: Labour-intensive removal efforts to stop snaring crisis in the Southeast Asia

She was met only by large piles of rubble, bags of trash, old rusted fences, and smashed plastic chairs and tables.

item.title: Việt Nam pushes for carbon market development

item.title: Greenhouse gas emissions inventory and reporting manual launched
item.description: The State Securities Commission of Vietnam (SSC) in collaboration with the International Finance Corporation (IFC) held a ceremony in Hà Nội on Tuesday to launch a manual on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions inventory and reporting.

item.title: People’s safety takes priority as central highlands hit by floods, landslides
item.description: Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development Nguyễn Hoàng Hiệp requested Đắk Nông Province to prioritise the safety of people amid the complex and unpredictable developments of flooding and landslides triggered by prolonged heavy rains.

item.title: PM urges response to flood consequences in northern mountainous, midland region as death count hits 10
item.description: The National Centre for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting has predicted that downpours will continue in this region from now through August 8, with rainfalls of 50-120mm, even over 180mm, which will continue posing very high risks of floods, flash floods, and landslides.

item.title: Recycling old batteries a growing movement in environmental protection
item.description: Triệu Thị Thủy Tiên, a student from the Vietnam University of Commerce in Hà Nội, has been sorting out and recycling more than 300 old batteries.

item.title: Central Highlands provinces continue to have heavy rains, landslides
item.description: Central Highlands provinces continue to have heavy rains during recent days leading to flooding and landslides in many places.

item.title: Workshop seeks to reduce plastic bag use at supermarkets
item.description: Activities in response to the International Plastic Bag Free Day at retailers are the first step to successfully implementing Việt Nam's goal of reducing plastic waste pollution, Thắng said.

item.title: HCM City supports locals residents affected by Thanh Đa subsidence
item.description: HCM City is supporting locals who are affected by subsidence on a section of Thanh Đa Canal Embankment, which has damaged 15 houses and creates high risks of landslides.

item.title: Four missing in landslide in Lâm Đồng Province
item.description: Dozens of tonnes of rock and soil blocks slid down covering the entire road surface of the pass, on which the Mađaguôi traffic police station is located.

item.title: Recently opened expressway flooded, causing prolonged congestion
item.description: The recently opened Dầu Giây - Phan Thiết expressway in the south central province of Bình Thuận was hit by heavy rainfall over the weekend, leading to severe flooding and prolonged congestion.

item.title: Two bears rescued and brought to Tam Đảo National Park
item.description: The bears, now named Bonnie and Clyde, were micro-chipped and kept in a family in Bình Dương Province for nearly 20 years.

item.title: HCM City canals polluted again few years after costly clean-up
item.description: HCM City’s canals, thoroughly cleaned a few years ago, are again severely polluted because of dumping of waste and untreated wastewater.

item.title: Garbage mountains seriously affect people's lives in Mekong Delta region
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of tonnes of garbage which piled up like mountains, without comprehensive treatment measures, have been polluting the environment, affecting the lives of people in the Mekong Delta region.

item.title: Việt Nam supports the global treaty on plastic pollution
item.description: This reflected the spirit of solidarity and cooperation among nations in addressing current environmental challenges, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment’s Vietnam Agency of Seas and Islands has said.

item.title: Standard Chartered accelerates sustainable development of carbon market in Việt Nam
item.description: Standard Chartered Bank and CIX shared experiences in operating a voluntary carbon credit exchange in Singapore and the next steps to set one up in Việt Nam.

item.title: Water accumulation at hydroelectric dams leads to consecutive earthquakes
item.description: Four earthquakes hit Kon Plông District in Kon Tum Province on the morning of July 20 ranging from 2.6 to 3.1 in magnitude.

item.title: Việt Nam considers domestic carbon credit exchange to enhance efficiency in green transactions
item.description: This initiative aims to boost centralisation, transparency, and overall efficiency in managing related transactions, according to Tăng Thế Cường, Head of the Department of Climate Change under the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment.

item.title: Quảng Ngãi invests $30 million on erosion prevention projects
item.description: The central province of Quảng Ngãi is implementing a series of projects to combat coastal and river erosion, aiming to stabilise the livelihoods of locals.

item.title: Northern region experiences heavy rainfall as Talim makes landfall
item.description: The storm is forecast to move northwest at a speed of about 20km per hour and gradually weaken in the next several hours.

item.title: Prime Minister presides over national COP26 Steering Committee on green growth
item.description: Việt Nam’s favourable natural conditions for renewable energy, as well as the requirements of green standards in the European export markets, drive the country towards green transformation.

item.title: Việt Nam and CropLife Asia sign MoU on sustainable use of pesticides
item.description: Under the MoU, CropLife will leverage industry efforts to work with relevant stakeholders in Việt Nam to establish a framework for using pesticides sustainably and advance innovation to support smallholder farmers in Việt Nam.

item.title: Prudential Vietnam hosts workshop on thematic bonds, green transition investment
item.description: Prudential Vietnam and the Climate Bonds Initiative, supported by the British Chamber of Commerce, organised the “Thematic bonds & Transition investment Workshop” in Hanoi on July 6 to seek feedback on how to support the growth and development of the thematic/labelled bond market in Việt Nam.

item.title: Migrant workers express gratitude to Bình Dương by cleaning up environment
item.description: Black, stinky canals full of garbage and overgrown grass have become greener and cleaner under the cleanup of the group of young people.

item.title: Bears' new life
item.description: After surviving illegal trafficking, the remarkable rehabilitation of bears at a sanctuary in Ninh Bình has enthralled countless visitors. The owners hope to extend this model, aiming to save, heal, and rehabilitate more bears, inspiring the next generation to protect and preserve our precious wildlife.

item.title: Langurs conservation group film wins international forest film award
item.description: The film, a co-production of WWF-Việt Nam and Melt Films, was made to honour a volunteer conservation group that inspired their community to protect the last remaining members of this langur species.

item.title: Bryde whales return to the south-central Vietnamese coast
item.description: Those might be the two whales that came to the sea off Bình Định Province last year.

item.title: Expanding payment mechanisms for ecosystem services to bolster conservation efforts
item.description: The efficacy of such payment schemes for ecosystem services has been proven through their successful implementation in forest ecosystems across Việt Nam.

item.title: Multiple plans in place to improve HCM City's waste management
item.description: Pollution from household trash has been a pressing issue for local residents, especially those who live near collection points.

item.title: Workshop on carbon capture, use, and storage explores Việt Nam potential
item.description: With a commitment to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050, Việt Nam recognises the importance of CCUS in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, as stated in the National Strategy for Climate Change to 2050.

item.title: Water management requires clear responsibilities from ministries: experts
item.description: Experts have said that it is necessary to develop a mechanism that could radically address the ongoing shortcomings regarding national water management.

item.title: National Park sees better protection thanks to eco-tourism
item.description: Forest rangers are always on patrol even without eco-tourism. But in addition to law enforcers, the daily presence of dozens of visitors also discourages potential criminals and helps detect wrongdoings.

item.title: Zero plastic waste hotels
item.description: More and more tourism enterprises in Việt Nam have replaced single-use plastic products with ones made with longer-lasting materials to save the environment. Green tourism has become a positive trend throughout the country.

item.title: Việt Nam, Netherlands tighten cooperation in climate change adaptation
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Trần Hồng Hà will co-chair the 8th meeting of the Việt Nam-Netherlands Intergovernmental Committee on Climate Change Adaptation and Water Management slated for June 25-27 in The Hague.

item.title: Trà Vinh’s ambitious plan to eliminate plastic waste
item.description: Trà Vinh Province has been making efforts to tackle plastic pollution, and has ambitious goals.

item.title: Dolphins spotted off Đà Nẵng coast
item.description: Several people said they believe that the presence of dolphins indicated positive signs for the marine environment surrounding the Sơn Trà Peninsula.

item.title: Ten monkeys released into the wild at Bái Tử Long National Park
item.description: They belong to four species - long-tailed, rhesus, Assam, and stump-tailed macaques, scientifically known as Macaca fascicularis, Macaca mulatta, Macaca assamensis, and Macaca arctoides, respectively.

item.title: Local residents struggling with polluted water near treatment plant
item.description: Residents in the southern province of Đồng Tháp are stricken with contaminated water in a local canal, affecting irrigation. Authorities are searching for the cause.

item.title: Water levels in northern region lakes defy flood season commencement
item.description: The water levels in the lakes are rising slowly, resulting in moderate electricity generation.

item.title: Rare Burmese peacock-pheasant discovered in Bình Phước
item.description: Having never seen this species of bird before, Ngô Quốc Đạt researched on social media and realised that it was a Burmese Peacock-Pheasant belonging to Group IIB, a critically endangered and rare group in need of conservation.

item.title: Seeding interest in biodiversity
item.description: With nature declining globally at rates unprecedented in human history, Vietnam is racing to protect its biodiversity. Its private sector is becoming increasing aware of the importance of biodiversity conservation. Many companies have engaged with agrobiodiversity protection and reaped environmental and economic benefits from it.

item.title: Agreement of the high seas adopted
item.description: The adoption of this treaty is an historic achievement marking the successful end of more than a decade of multilateral work.

item.title: HCM City turns 243 garbage dumps into parks, veggie gardens
item.description: Last year, the city had an additional 113 polluted sites caused by piles of garbage.

item.title: Vietnamese, Lao localities enhance cooperation in forest, wildlife protection
item.description: The two nations have had long-lasting cooperation in many development areas of Laos, especially in ago-forestry collaboration.

item.title: Residents in many areas of Đồng Tháp at constant risk of erosion
item.description: Erosion occurred in many areas of Đồng Tháp Province, turning people’s lives upside down, and putting them at constant risk of their homes collapsing.

item.title: JICA to fund project to help Việt Nam establish sustainable water supply system
item.description: The project, under the Science and Technology Research Partnership for Sustainable Development (SATREPS)1 Programme, focuses on research and development of new water treatment technology using advanced nanofiltration membranes.

item.title: Waste disturbs locals, tourists in southern province’s beach
item.description: Since Thursday afternoon, a large amount of ocean waste, primarily seaweed, has been carried ashore by the tides onto several beaches in the area.

item.title: Việt Nam active in efforts to reduce carbon emissions from aviation activities
item.description: Việt Nam’s aviation industry and airlines has made efforts in environmental protection and climate change response for sustainable development, he said, adding that the Ministry of Transport always creates favourable conditions in terms of procedures, mechanisms, and policies for airlines and other units in the industry to well perform international tasks in civil aviation activities.

item.title: Born to be wild
item.description: Amid an increase in trafficking cases, organisations are making tremendous efforts to provide support for wildlife rescue. Hanoi Wildlife Rescue Centre reintroduces up to 700 wild animals of all kinds into forests across the country, while over 80 per cent of the bears rescued by Animals Asia were voluntarily handed in by their former owners.

item.title: Residents in natural disaster prone Cà Mau battle landslides, rising sea levels
item.description: Trần Thanh, a fisherwoman in Khánh Bình Tây Commune, Trần Văn Thời District said she could never forget the time when she was on the brink of life and death during a high tide that has occurred recently.

item.title: UN project to combat zoonotic disease risks from wildlife kicks off in Việt Nam
item.description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) in close collaboration with the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), and the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) on Thursday (June 8) kicked off the Safety Across Asia for the Global Environment (SAFE) project.

item.title: HCM City promotes digital transformation in waste management
item.description: HCM City is making efforts to promote digital transformation in the collection, treatment and management of the huge volume of domestic solid waste discharged daily.

item.title: Việt Nam discovers 158 new species during 2021-22
item.description: Some of the newly discovered species in Việt Nam are highly regarded by scientists worldwide, including Cát Bà begonia (Begonia catbensis) found on the limestone hills of Cát Bà National Park, frog species Quasipaa taoi on Ngọc Linh mountain - the highest peak in central Việt Nam, and Intermedius sunbeam snake in a locality within the central Trường Sơn region of Việt Nam.

item.title: Efforts made to mitigate ocean plastic waste in Việt Nam
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment's Vietnam Administration of Seas and Islands has said that the national target of reducing 50 per cent of ocean plastic waste by 2025 was highly ambitious. Achieving this goal would require more comprehensive measures and strong determination from the entire society, including state management agencies, businesses, and citizens.

item.title: Việt Nam needs solutions to mitigate plastic waste in agricultural production
item.description: Việt Nam needs to promote effective solutions in order to solve plastic pollution in the agricultural sector now.

item.title: Trị An Lake's low water level
item.description: Water levels at Đồng Nai Province's Trị An hydroelectric reservoir, the largest of its kind in Southern Việt Nam, are extremely low due to the recent, intense heatwave. This is seriously harming the livelihoods of fishermen and fish farmers.

item.title: Hà Nội’s West Lake to be given a makeover
item.description: The district authority will also plan to renovate and embellish the infrastructure around the lake, such as installing lighting systems and upgrading promenades and flower gardens.

item.title: Trị An hydro-power reservoir dries up, impacting people’s livelihoods
item.description: Trị An hydro-power reservoir in the southern province of Đồng Nai is facing a severe drought, according to Trị An Hydropower Company.

item.title: Huế pilots electric trucks for waste collection
item.description: These are the first electric trucks for garbage collection in Việt Nam.

item.title: PM urges stronger wildfire prevention measures amid strong heatwaves
item.description: Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính has urged stepping up wildfire prevention measures as heatwaves are scorching many localities nationwide, increasing the risk of wildfires.

item.title: Flights diverted, delayed due to bad weather at Tân Sơn Nhất Airport
item.description: Bad weather at Tân Sơn Nhất Airport, HCM City on May 16 and 21 caused 12 flights to be delayed and seven to be diverted to the alternate airports.

item.title: Working group established to study using marine sand in construction
item.description: Deputy transport minister Nguyễn Duy Lâm has been assigned as the head of the team, while deputy minister of natural resources and environment Trần Quý Kiên is the deputy head.

item.title: Đồng Nai afforestation programme kicks off

item.title: Workshop discusses role of corporate in biodiversity conservation
item.description: It is important for businesses to enhance green production, protect biodiversity and ecology, and strive for green labelling. These will be competitive advantages that help them compete with others to export agricultural or food products to the world.

item.title: New task force promotes innovation and financing for plastic waste reduction
item.description: The Việt Nam National Plastic Action Partnership (NPAP) has launched a new task force to promote innovation and catalyse investment in effective solutions for reducing plastic waste and pollution in Việt Nam.

item.title: Environment authorities to inspect dust mitigation measures at Long Thành airport
item.description: Đồng Nai’s Department of Natural Resources and Environment said it will coordinate with other agencies to monitor the company’s implementation of dust mitigation measures at the project twice a week.

item.description: Tiền Giang Province’s two upstream districts along the Tiền River are repairing 3.3km of eroded river and canal banks at 79 locations at a cost of VNĐ67.6 billion (US$2.9 million) raised from various sources.

item.title: Early warning of disaster risks means better response and prevention
item.description: Hoàng Đức Cường, Deputy Director of the General Department of Meteorology and Hydrology at the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, talks to the Vietnam News Agency about the importance of establishing an early warning system associated with impact forecasting.

item.title: Rare sea turtle released back to wild
item.description: The turtle, scientific name Eretmochelys imbricata, is one of the five sea turtle species in danger of extinction in the world and Việt Nam. Many of them are living in the territorial waters of Bà Rịa – Vũng Tàu Province's Côn Đảo District.

item.title: Việt Nam urged to prioritise renewable energy development
item.description: As energy demand continues to rise and domestic sources of fossil fuels for electricity generation become increasingly scarce, ensuring national energy security has become a pressing issue that requires a long-term vision.

item.title: Wetlands conservation in Việt Nam critical to biodiversity and eco-balance
item.description: A ceremony was held in Cao Lãnh City in the Mekong Delta province of Đồng Tháp on Friday to launch a campaign on the conservation and sustainable use of wetlands in Việt Nam.

item.title: Zoom empowers Grab for employee engagement
item.description: Zoom announced it will empower Grab to boost employee engagement across its offices.

item.title: Northern region faces high risk of serious electricity shortage
item.description: In a report to the Ministry of Industry and Trade, EVN underlined that the water level at reservoirs in the northern region in the first four months of this year was equivalent to 70-90 per cent of the average in years before.

item.title: AstraZeneca to invest $50 million in forest, landscape restoration in Việt Nam
item.description: AstraZeneca has recently announced a new investment of up to US$50 million into Việt Nam as part of the company’s global AZ Forest programme, which by the end of 2022 had planted over 10.5 million trees worldwide.

item.title: Sơn Trà Nature Reserve needs sustainable monkey solutions
item.description: Between January and April, 459 traps were found on the reserve and 500 illegal trespass cases were reported to the inter-forest protection sub-department of Sơn Trà-Ngũ Hành Sơn.

item.title: Consumers still favour plastic bags due to their cost-effectiveness
item.description: Normally, eco-friendly products cost twice as much as plastic products, causing consumers and small businesses to be reluctant to use the former.

item.title: Large turtle caught and released back to natural habitat
item.description: A sea turtle, weighing more than 100kg, which was accidentally caught in the net of a local fisherman, was released back to the sea in the central province of Thừa Thiên-Huế on Thursday, leaders of the Lăng Cô Border Post said.

item.title: Quảng Ngãi proposes spending $10.6 million on rainwater collection for Lý Sơn Island
item.description: The system is expected to collect one million cubic metres of rainwater per year with a fund of VNĐ250 billion (US$10.6 million).

item.description: Farmers in Dong Nai are facing a failed harvest due to red dust pollution from the construction site of the mega Long Thanh International Airport project. The dust is sticking to leaves, hindering photosynthesis and leading to nutrition deficiency in their crops.

item.title: Plan approved to realise net-zero emissions goal by 2050
item.description: Việt Nam is determined to pursue rapid and sustainable economic growth combined with environmental protection to progress to prosperity.

item.title: Traditional forest ritual protects Mother Nature
item.description: Forest worship practices have existed in the consciousness and life of ethnic minorities for a long time, featured in local ceremonies and festivals based on concepts of the universe and animism and represented by sacred forest gods.

item.title: Côn Đảo National Park recognised as ASEAN Heritage Park
item.description: The Côn Đảo National Park off the coast of the southern province of Bà Rịa-Vũng Tàu received the ASEAN Heritage Park certificate at a ceremony held on April 28.v

item.title: 35 rare, endangered animals adopted by Tây Ninh
item.description: 35 wild animal species, including endangered ones, have been adopted by Tây Ninh Forest Management Department since the beginning of this year.

item.title: Soft-shelled turtle of rare species dies in Hà Nội
item.description: The Đồng Mô Lake turtle was discovered by Asian Turtle Program conservationists in 2007. During the historic floods in Hà Nội in 2008, it got out of the lake and was caught by local residents.

item.description: People of Đà Bắc District of the northern province Hoà Bình have been suffering a severe water shortage for years despite residing right in the Đà River basin.

item.title: Việt Nam has a lot of work to do to complete national marine spatial planning
item.description: Việt Nam has a lot of work to do to complete the national marine spatial planning as the country is still at a relatively early stage in the process of formulating both its coastal zone planning and sustainable management of resources.

item.description: Experts say it is time for agencies to join hands to reduce plastic rubbish and target green and sustainable tourism.

item.title: Đồng Nai farmers lose harvest due to Long Thành Airport red dust
item.description: The adverse effects of this pollution are felt keenly in the region, and the relevant authorities must take necessary measures to protect the livelihoods of the local farmers and prevent further environmental degradation.

item.title: Project conveys message about the environment through the lens of art
item.description: The exhibition is expected to take visitors on an artistic trip to Côn Đảo Island, where the main events of the LIFE project take place in May. There they could envision Côn Đảo Coastline by seeing its physical elements like rocks, sand, the sound of the sea, and human performances.

item.title: Companies launch programme promoting environmental protection
item.description: P&G Vietnam, in collaboration with Central Retail Vietnam and Gaia Vietnam, has launched the forest restoration programme "Vì Bạn Ươm Mầm Một Việt Nam Xanh - Forests For Good".

item.description: The plantation, located on 18.1 hectares in Hòa Liên Commune, consists of dalbergia tonkinnensis and pterocarpus macrocarpus, which will help residents in the commune boost sustainable production and the forestry economy.

item.title: Artificial reef placement proves useful in Cà Mau Province
item.description: Surveys conducted before and after the placement also indicated a considerable improvement in local fishermen’s income.

item.title: 13ha of Đà Lạt pine forest engulfed by fire
item.description: Over 13 hectares of pine forest were destroyed in a forest fire occurring in area 267A of Đà Lạt City’s Prenn Pass.

item.title: Việt Nam proposes Mekong River Commission reform operational methods
item.description: Vietnamese Deputy Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Lê Công Thành suggested the Mekong River Commission (MRC) focus on practical measures to protect the legitimate rights and interests of residents who live on the river’s water resources, while addressing a ministers’ meeting in Vientiane, Laos, on Tuesday.

item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta needs more than VNĐ94.3 trillion (nearly US$4 billion) to improve its road infrastructure in order to boost its inter-provincial connectivity while mitigating the impacts of climate change.

item.title: An Giang plans to build major freshwater storage system
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of An Giang plans to soon build a freshwater storage system and infrastructure to serve agriculture in the Long Xuyên Quadrangle.

item.title: HCM City, RoK foster collaboration in environmental protection
item.description: HCM City official expects the RoK will share experiences with the city in mobilising international resources to support adaptation and prevention of disasters caused by climate change.

item.title: Female reporters honoured for reporting on environmental issues
item.description: The 'Pioneering Women Journalist for Environment' award ceremony recognised these women's remarkable contributions to journalism.

item.title: Mekong Delta to increase forest cover
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta region is growing more forests to protect the environment from climate change and mitigate the impacts of natural disasters.

item.title: Red soil dust from Long Thành Airport blankets homes, puts health at risk
item.description: A pulmonologist said that daily exposure to dust can severely affect people’s health, causing damage to the lining of the respiratory tract or leading to pneumonia, lung infection and pulmonary fibrosis.

item.title: German-funded project supports Việt Nam in implementing Paris Agreement
item.description: The project was funded by the German Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety (BMWK), under the International Climate Initiative (IKI), and implemented by the German Corporation for International Cooperation (GIZ) from 2019 to 2023.

item.title: Việt Nam calls for comprehensive, all-society approach to waste management

item.description: Improving policy and communication strategies on wildlife protection and management was the main theme of a high-level policy dialogue taking place in Hà Nội on March 24.

item.title: Transport Debate Competition promote green movement
item.description: The competition attracted 28 teams of students from 21 universities, colleges, and academies nationwide participating.

item.title: Residents in Ninh Thuận suffer from high intensity of dust from sugar factory
item.description: Residents of Đô Vinh Ward in the south-central province of Ninh Thuận have been living with high intensity of dust released from a nearby sugar factory.

item.title: Wild elephants causes havoc for residents in Bình Phước
item.description: According to a report by Dân Việt newspaper, the elephants have caused damage to numerous trees in gardens and farming fields at Thạch Màng Hamlet, located in the Tân Lợi Commune of the Đồng Phú District.

item.title: Việt Nam carries out measures for healthy forests
item.description: At a forum on the International Day of the Forest yesterday in Hà Nội, Phạm Hồng Lượng, chief of office of the General Department of Forestry, stressed the importance of raising awareness about the role of forests in human life to work together in forest protection and sustainable forest exploitation.

item.title: Practical and effective activities urged to mark World Water Day
item.description: This year, the theme of World Water Day is “Accelerating Change” which aims to raise awareness and provide education about the global water crisis.

item.title: Efforts made to protect gray-shanked douc langurs in Phú Yên
item.description: The surveys, conducted from February 10-15, aimed to collect information on the population, distribution, and habitat of gray-shanked douc langurs.

item.title: Wildlife protection requires joint efforts from all stakeholders
item.description: Sea turtles have been included in the Red List of the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN), and the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES).

item.title: Huế, Đà Nẵng to recycle plastic waste at source
item.description: According to the city's sub-department of environment protection, the plastic waste recycling formula is part of a project funded by the Danish International Development Agency (Danida) and implemented through International Development Enterprises between 2021 and 2024.

item.title: Việt Nam strives to eliminate substances harmful to ozone layer
item.description: This decision has been incorporated in the Law on Environmental Protection 2020 and other relevant documents.

item.title: HCM City to strictly regulate illegal encroachment on canals
item.description: The HCM City People’s Council has discussed feasible measures to address the issue of encroachment into drainage systems and litter in the Nhiêu Lộc-Thị Nghè Canal.

item.title: Illegal pangolin traders arrested in Central Highlands province
item.description: Three men involved in the illegal trading of pangolins, a critically endangered species, have been arrested.

item.title: Rare civet species discovered in central nature reserve
item.description: Phạm Anh Tuấn, director of the Xuân Liên Natural Reserve Management Board, said that a project on the investigation and preservation of species of the civet family (Viverridae) in the natural reserve has been implemented since 2021.

item.title: Unilever Vietnam, Duy Tân Recycling sign “Partnership on plastic collection and recycling”
item.description: The partnership is a step forward in promoting the use of recycled plastic in Unilever’s packaging production, thereby increasing recycling activities and creating a cycle for plastic waste in Việt Nam.

item.title: Rare turtle species discovered in central Việt Nam
item.description: These species have been listed in the Việt Nam Red Book and need to be conserved.

item.title: Hà Nội needs solution for sorting solid waste at source

item.title: Bến Tre Province expands forest cover with eye on climate change
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Bến Tre plans to increase its forest cover, especially by growing mangroves, to mitigate the impacts of climate change and combine them with aquaculture to increase people’s incomes.

item.title: Ministry plans to increase environmental protection tax on non-biodegradable packaging
item.description: Expanding the tax base and increasing environmental protection tax on non-biodegradable packaging materials would be considered with an aim to limit the use of these materials.

item.title: Decade-long general planning scheme for Cửu Long river basin approved
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Trần Hồng Hà has signed a decision approving the general planning scheme of the Cửu Long (Mekong) river basin for the 2021-2030 period.

item.title: Việt Nam takes drastic action to combat wildlife trafficking and protect biodiversity
item.description: Statistics from the Forest Protection Department show that the number of violations related to wildlife across the nation decreased by 147 cases per year from 2018-2022 compared to 2013-2017.

item.title: Habit of burning straw persists in Hà Nội's suburban areas
item.description: Despite numerous attempts by the municipal authority to curb the burning of rice straw, this practice persists.

item.title: Environment pollution authorities call for action addressing air pollution
item.description: Satellite images show that air pollution has badly affected many areas across the country.

item.title: Việt Nam offers initiatives to promote cooperation to reduce emissions in Asia
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Trần Hồng Hà presented several important initiatives of Việt Nam during the Asia Zero Emission Community (AZEC) Ministerial Meeting in Tokyo, Japan on Saturday.

item.title: World Wildlife Day: More efforts needed to protect Việt Nam's biodiversity
item.description: March 3 is World Wildlife Day. It is a United Nations International day to celebrate all the world's wild animals and plants and the contribution that they make to our lives and the health of the planet. This date was chosen as it is the birthday of CITES, the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora, signed in 1973.

item.title: Coffee, rubber and many others affected by new EU policies on anti-deforestation
item.description: Việt Nam, one of the EU's main importer of forestry-based products is facing great challenges in adapting to these new policies from the EU.

item.title: Conservation of wetland habitats contributes to carbon storage
item.description: Việt Nam needs to develop a national policy on operating a carbon credit exchange; and make legal documents on economic valuation of carbon sequestration and storage functions of mangrove forests

item.title: Ambassador: US Embassy looks to help Việt Nam with biodiversity protection
item.description: One of the efforts taken by the US Embassy in Việt Nam is to help the country with sustainable development, and partner with local communities to protect Việt Nam's biodiversity, said US Ambassador to Việt Nam Marc Knapper.

item.title: Solutions to protect Hà Nội's water sources
item.description: Hà Nội has 104 irrigation lakes, 105 rivers and canals with total length of more than 799km, according to the municipal Department of Natural Resources and Environment (DoNRE).

item.title: Salt water intrusion of Mekong estuaries forecast to increase in March
item.description: As reported by the National Center for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting, the level of saltwater intrusion in the Mekong Delta during the dry season of 2022-2023 is projected to be similar to that of previous years.

item.title: Various types of wild animals found at house in Lâm Đồng
item.description: A total of 70 animals were found, including 26 chồn hương (Small Indian Civet), three snakes (including two King Cobra), six gà rừng (red junglefowl) and 37 bamboo rats.

item.title: Builders eye sea sand for construction as river sand runs out
item.description: The General Department of Geological and Minerals of Việt Nam is urgently carrying out work related to assessing sea sand exploitation for levelling highways, transport and urban infrastructure projects in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta in southern Việt Nam.

item.title: Elephant's death in central Việt Nam remains a mystery
item.description: Lê Xuân Đình, head of the district’s Forest Ranger Division, said the elephant's carcass was found in the deep forest by villagers.

item.title: HCM City seeks to build low-carbon city
item.description: HCM City is cooperating with the World Bank (WB) to implement a programme called ‘A low-carbon city development’ towards developing a domestic carbon market.

item.title: Urban development must adapt, help combat climate change: experts
item.description: It is necessary to increase tree coverage to reduce the effect of heat-induced problems and increase the absorption of greenhouse gas emissions in urban areas in order to contribute to realising the target of net-zero emissions by 2050, according to Nguyễn Tuấn Quang from the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE).

item.title: US, Việt Nam to counter wildlife trafficking through sea ports
item.description: The growing demand for endangered, exotic, and protected wildlife drives a global illegal market, valued at more than US$20 billion per year.

item.title: Tam Kỳ City launches ‘Say No to wildlife’ campaign
item.description: The city's People's Committee has unveiled a series of action programs to eliminate all wildlife-related activities, from trade and transportation to storage and cooking in restaurants and shops.

item.title: Prolonged pollution from agricultural waste affects people's lives
item.description: The discharge of waste from animal husbandry and farm produce processing are the main causes of rural environmental pollution, which has become more severe recently in a new-style rural commune in Sơn La province.

item.title: Endangered, rare gray-shanked douc langurs found in local garden
item.description: On the morning of February 10, an individual of this kind of primate appeared in the garden of Lê Văn Thành in Cẩm Tú Village.

item.title: Germany supports urban ecosystem-based adaptation in Quang Binh
item.description: The province of Quang Binh and the German Government inaugurated three models of urban ecosystem-based adaptation (EbA) measures in Dong Hoi City on February 10, 2023.

item.title: Efforts exerted to increase climate change adaptability of Mekong Delta urban systems
item.description: Climate change is posing a great challenge to the Mekong Delta region, especially erosion, landslides, flooding, and pollution.

item.title: RoK-funded mangrove restoration project launched in Ninh Bình
item.description: The five-year project has total funding of US$4.39 million, with $3.79 million coming from the RoK’s non-refundable aid. It targets 250 hectares of new mangrove forests in Kim Sơn, Ninh Bình, and at the Xuân Thuỷ National Park in Nam Định Province.

item.title: Northern region to see humid weather until April
item.description: The northern region of Việt Nam will continue to experience humid weather until April, according to Nguyễn Văn Hưởng, head of the weather forecast division under the National Centre for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting.

item.title: Hải Phòng authorities seize another 42 smuggled ivory tusks
item.description: The discovery came after a suspicious 40-foot container was inspected by the Coast Guard Region 1, in coordination with the Hải Phòng Customs Department and relevant authorities.

item.title: Water resources planning scheme for 2021-2030 announced
item.description: By 2025, the planning scheme targets increasing the rate of daily clean water use to 95-100 per cent for the urban population and 65 per cent for rural residents.

item.title: Domestic elephant to be taken to Yôk Đôn National Park
item.description: This is the eighth domestic elephant collected by the Centre for Elephant Conservation, Animal Rescue and Forest Protection, part of the cooperation programme between Đắk Lắk Province authorities and the AAF.

item.title: Cold weather to blanket northern Việt Nam during Tết
item.description: The cold spell is forecast to linger through the country's longest holiday, which lasts from January 20-26.

item.title: Workshop discusses marine spatial planning for sustainable oceans in Việt Nam
item.description: The workshop was co-organised by the Vietnamese Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE), the People's Committee of Quảng Bình Province, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and the Norwegian Embassy in Hà Nội.

item.title: Back to the wild
item.description: In 2022, residents of Thừa Thiên – Huế Province handed over more than 80 species, many of which were endangered, to the provincial forest rangers to release them back into the wild. This was made possible by the province's programmes to educate the public about wildlife protection and conservation, as well as its training courses for forest rangers. The results show a positive change in the community's awareness of the meaning and importance of wildlife conservation.

item.title: Rich biodiversity database debuts
item.description: It contains 1,100 documents, with 1,000 photos and 53 video clips, from a number of organisations, photographers, biologists and the local community.

item.title: Mekong Delta begins work to keep saltwater at bay during dry season
item.description: Authorities in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta have taken proactive prevention measures to mitigate the impacts of saltwater intrusion in rivers in the 2022-23 dry season.

item.title: Fewer storms to hit Vietnam this year
item.description: The Vietnam Disaster Management Authority under the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) said up to 1,057 natural disasters hit the country last year, leaving 175 dead and causing economic losses of some VNĐ19.5 trillion (US$828.55 million).

item.title: Water resources planning for 2021-2030 approved
item.description: The goal by 2030 is to harmonise and distribute water resources fairly and reasonably among sectors, localities, and water exploiters and users according to the integrated planning of inter-provincial river basins.

item.title: Community-based protection promotes forest conservation
item.description: Community assigned forest protection has helped improve the management and conservation of large areas of natural forest as it promotes the role and responsibility of local people on 7,833ha in Quảng Nam and Thừa Thiên Huế.

item.title: Gov’t to step up prevention, punishment of wildlife crimes
item.description: Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính has approved a plan to strengthen the prevention and combat of wildlife and biodiversity crimes by 2030 with a vision to 2050.

item.title: PAN Group teams up for wetland conservation by restoring 17ha of the melaleuca forest
item.description: The project is within the framework of a two-year cooperation agreement between the three parties, implemented from December 2022 to December 2024.

item.title: Bình Phước residents take action to protect forests
item.description: The province has invested in building 40 water tanks to respond to forest fires promptly.

item.title: TCP Group sets goal to supply 100% recyclable packaging by 2024
item.description: TCP Group (T.C.Pharma), the owner of the popular Thai energy drink brands such as Red Bull and Warrior, asserts its commitment to sustainable development in all business activities by working with the local community to create a waste-free environment.

item.title: Việt Nam strives to be global processing center of export timber
item.description: Aiming to be one of the world’s leading processing centers of export timber, Việt Nam is striving to establish legal timber, where raw materials are legally sourced and traded throughout the entire value chain.

item.title: Forest carbon market in Việt Nam does not correspond to its potential
item.description: The carbon market has been promoted by the international community as an effective financial mechanism to reduce emissions, prevent deforestation and forest degradation, protecting forests.

item.title: Comprehensive solutions needed for Hải Phòng flooding
item.description: Urgent and comprehensive measures are required to improve the capacity of water drainage in the city.

item.title: Animals of 14 rare species released into Bù Gia Mập National Park
item.description: The Bù Gia Mập National Park has coordinated with authorities in Bình Phước and other localities to save and release nearly 500 captive individuals of many endangered fauna species into the wild in 2022.

item.title: Quảng Ninh's Ba Chẽ District overachieves goals for timber forest growing
item.description: The results have created a sound foundation for sustainable development and environmental protection.

item.title: Restoring clarity to rivers in Hà Nội
item.description: People in Hà Nội are not at all unfamiliar with the pollution in Tô Lịch, Đáy, Nhuệ rivers, and the effects of pollution here is an neverending story. Báo Tài Nguyên Môi Trường (Environment Resources Newspaper) reports.

item.title: Quảng Ninh and smart environment strategy
item.description: Quảng Ninh Province has always paid special attention and adequate resources to environmental protection.

item.title: Quảng Trị: 70kg sea turtle released back to the wild
item.description: A 70kg sea turtle that was accidentally caught in the net of a local fisherman was released back to the sea in the central province of Quảng Trị on Thursday.

item.title: Cold spell forecast to hit northern region tonight, steep temperature drop expected
item.description: A northeasterly cold front is forecast to come to the northern region, causing the temperature to drop to 9-12 degrees Celsius, accompanied by chilly thunderstorms.

item.title: “No country can fix climate change on its own”: PM
item.description: Speaking at GEFE 2022, the PM said all solutions to global warming require global cooperation, and people must be a central pillar of any successful climate change strategy.

item.title: Communities join hands to conserve Hòn Yến wetlands, corals
item.description: Local communities in An Hòa Commune, Tuy An District of the southern province of Phú Yên have been making changes to conserve the Hòn Yến wetlands while still improving their livelihoods through sustainable economic development

item.title: Đắk Lắk spends more than $2.2 million to end elephant rides
item.description: Trần Xuân Phước, director of the Đắk Lắk Centre for Elephant Conservation, Animal Rescue and Forest Protection Management, said the centre would implement the project.

item.title: Project on plastic waste management based on circular economy model launched in Cần Giờ
item.description: The objective of the project, sponsored by Coca-Cola Foundation, is to facilitate collaboration between consumers, waste pickers, recyclers, and local authorities to pilot the new and innovative approach of Circular Economy and provide feedback for National Policy adaptation.

item.title: 'Ring the Golden Bell' contest tackles environmental pollution
item.description: The contest took place on Wednesday at Phượng Hoàng School in Duy Tân Street in Vinh City with the aim of helping students understand the importance of the environment and provide them adequate knowledge on how to effectively protect it.

item.title: Stranded dolphin rescued near Quảng Ninh's Cô Tô Island
item.description: Fishermen speculated that the creature might have wandered astray from its pod inadvertently during a hunt trip.

item.title: Saving the bears
item.description: Since 2017, Four Paws has completed 24 bear rescue missions in Việt Nam. Five years have passed since the first rescue and now 49 Asiatic black bears are living happily in their forever home – the Bear Sanctuary Ninh Bình. There is still a lot of work to continue rescuing and protecting these animals and developing conservation awareness.

item.title: With better understanding, people voluntarily hand over rare endangered animals to authorities
item.description: Located in Central Trường Sơn, the forests of Thừa Thiên-Huế province have high biodiversity, with about 134 species of mammals and more than 500 types of birds.

item.title: Khánh Hoà issues master plan for Nha Trang Bay restoration
item.description: The Khánh Hòa Provincial People's Committee has just issued a master plan to preserve and restore coral reefs in Nha Trang Bay.

item.title: US, Việt Nam launch new five-year project to reduce environmental pollution
item.description: Việt Nam faces a series of environmental pollution challenges largely spurred by agriculture, transportation, and industrial production.

item.title: Workshop promotes technological solutions for waste collection, recycling
item.description: Digital technology solutions will help promote waste classification at source, and better managed waste collection, treatment and recycling, experts said at a recent workshop held in HCM City.

item.title: Asian experts discuss primate conservation in the region
item.description: Issues covered at the symposium range from the role of women in primate conservation science in Indonesia, developing the capacity of young researchers in primate conservation in Vietnam to the community-led conservation action for gibbons in Cambodia, and the use of thermal imaging with unmanned aerial vehicle in monitoring threatened primate communities in Việt Nam.

item.title: Việt Nam needs to look into recycling discarded vehicles: experts
item.description: Statistics revealed that Việt Nam has 4.5 million cars and 60 million motorbikes currently in use, and these figures are growing.

item.title: Việt Nam to take advantage of international support in climate change adaptation
item.description: Minister Nguyễn Hồng Hà spoke to Vietnam News Agency on the sidelines of the 27th United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP27) in Egypt.

item.title: World Bank praises Việt Nam ’s climate projects
item.description: A Vietnamese delegation led by Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Trần Hồng Hà attended an event regarding reducing greenhouse gas emissions in response to climate change.

item.title: HCM City authorities on high alert for erosion along rivers and canals
item.description: HCM City authorities have asked agencies and relevant units to take necessary measures to ensure safety for more than 1,300 residents living around 32 erosion-prone locations.

item.title: US pledges support to Việt Nam in energy transition
item.description: US Special Presidential Envoy for Climate John Kerry said the US will work together with Việt Nam to fulfill climate commitments.

item.title: COP27: Việt Nam highlights importance of energy transition in climate change response
item.description: Energy transition is a key factor for Việt Nam to realise the goal of bringing the net gas emissions to zero by 2050 that it committed at COP26.

item.title: Thủ Đức City loses US$54 million to floods annually
item.description: Flooding in Thủ Đức City will cause millions of dollars in damage if the city government does not take preventive measures, an expert said.

item.title: More than 100 endangered animals return to nature at southern national park
item.description: A total of 112 wild animals of 20 endangered species have been released into the forest at Bù Gia Mập National Park in the southern province of Bình Phước.

item.title: Đắk Lắk grows more forests for commercial exploitation
item.description: Đắk Lắk Province has planted 1,824ha of new forests so far this year, exceeding the target for the full year, according to its Department of Agriculture and Rural Development.

item.title: Turning over a new leaf
item.description: Two travel lovers, Đặng Đức Tuấn and Võ Minh Tân, made a four-month journey cross country to plant trees in all 63 provinces and cities in Việt Nam. They hope those green sprouts will help environmental tourism take root across the country. Their group “A little Vietnam” helps spread the message of environmental protection to the public.

item.title: Cần Thơ to build embankment along erosion-prone Trà Nóc River
item.description: Cần Thơ City will build an embankment to prevent erosion along the Trà Nóc River in Bình Thuỷ District in 2023-25 at a cost of VNĐ270 billion (US$10.9 million).

item.title: Huế goes ‘green’ by boosting electric traffic
item.description: The development of electric vehicles towards green traffic development in Huế City has been seen as a positive solution in implementing the public transport project that the province and UNDP have been focusing on.

item.title: Group in Đà Nẵng don't let disabilities stop them cleaning up city
item.description: Members of the Green Integration group, a group of people with disabilities, share a love for the environment and want to help the community.

item.title: Việt Nam, EU boost forest governance
item.description: Many efforts have been made by Việt Nam and Europe Union in improving forest governance and enhancing the legal framework for timber and timber products in general and for their export from Việt Nam to the EU and all other markets over past years.

item.title: Sài Gòn-Đồng Nai River polluted due to urbanisation
item.description: The river receives a huge volume of wastewater from residential areas, manufacturing plants, industrial parks and export processing zones located along the river. Wastewater along with rainwater runs through the sewer system, causing serious pollution.

item.title: Đồng Tháp faces increasing erosion
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Đồng Tháp is in the rainy season and facing flooding caused by the rising level of the Mekong River, and this makes erosion become more severe.

item.title: WWF launches campaign against high level of wildlife meat consumption in Việt Nam
item.description: Văn Ngọc Thịnh, Director of WWF Việt Nam, said that Việt Nam, Laos and Cambodia are showing high levels of wildlife consumption, especially mammals and birds that are easily found in markets and restaurants.

item.title: Community makes effort to reduce plastic rubbish
item.description: Hà Tĩnh City is an urban area with a large amount of daily waste discharged into the environment, causing Hà Tĩnh City People's Committee to implement a strategic action plan.

item.title: Typhoon Nesat to continue decreasing in intensity
item.description: Thanh Hóa and Nghệ An should expect 50-100mm of rainfall and up to 130mm in places.

item.title: One death reported in Đà Nẵng's historic floods
item.description: Flooding destroyed about 7.5 hectares of crops, while 2,524 power stations were damaged, affecting about 206,000 clients. So far, 1,032 of which have been repaired.

item.title: Storm SONCA causes worst Đà Nẵng floods in a decade
item.description: After weakening from a tropical storm to a low tropical pressure system, SONCA dumped up to 800mm of rain in many areas.

item.title: Bình Phước uses payment scheme to help protect forests
item.description: The policy of payments for forest environmental services in Bình Phước Province has helped protect and develop forests, and improve the livelihoods of forest protecting households.

item.title: One missing after landslide at power station in central region
item.description: A Vietnam News Agency correspondent reported that part of a mountain had collapsed onto the station.

item.title: Trading garbage for money in Quảng Ninh
item.description: After 6 months in operation, the "Garbage ATM" programme, named VRacBank, from Quảng Ninh Cement and Construction Company have gathered 20 tonnes of recylable trash and transferred out VNĐ100 million (US$4,190) to people across the city.

item.title: Cồn Soi villagers hope for bridge to end flood season isolation
item.description: The only road out of the village is submerged, leaving villagers with a stark choice; brave the waters, or stay in the village.

item.title: Two more national parks nominated for ASEAN heritage status
item.description: If approved, Việt Nam will have 12 protected areas recognised as ASEAN Heritage Parks.

item.title: Ministry prioritises clean water supply for rural areas
item.description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development will continue priotising the supply of clean water for disadvantage, mountainous and remote localities

item.title: Flash floods cause $4.16 million damage in Nghệ An
item.description: Recent flash floods, triggered by torrential rain, have cost up to VNĐ100 billion (US$4.16 million) in damage in Kỳ Sơn District in the central province of Nghệ An.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence applied to weather forecasting
item.description: The application of historical data and AI has created products. For example, he said that the trend of AI applications created positive results in the field of hydrometeorology.

item.title: Việt Nam has huge potential for co-processing of waste in cement industry
item.description: The country now has 82 clinker kilns in operation, which together each year consume over 10 million tonnes of anthracite coal, he said.

item.title: 123,000 sea turtles in Côn Đảo island released back to sea this year
item.description: The Côn Đảo National Park has been working hard to conserve sea turtles (Chelonioidea) for years, becoming an ideal nesting destination for the rare species in Việt Nam.

item.title: More protection of wild birds needed during migration season
item.description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development on Tuesday asked city and provincial people’s committees, as well as forest protection agencies, to strengthen inspections of the hunting, trading and consumption of wild birds.

item.title: Storm warning
item.description: With super typhoon Noru forecast to hit land in Vietnam tonight, rapid preparations are underway to protect those living in areas at risk. Already 400,000 people have been evacuated and boats safely moored. Stay safe everyone.

item.title: HCM City prepares to deal with high tides, supertyphoon Noru
item.description: The HCM City Steering Committee for Civil Defense - Natural Disaster Prevention and Control, and Search and Rescue has directed local authorities and relevant departments and agencies to be ready to take measures to combat the arrival of the super typhoon Noru and rising tides which is expected to cause flooding.

item.title: Northern and central provinces prepare for arrival of supertyphoon Noru
item.description: Northern and central provinces have been told to prepare for supertyphoon Noru, which is heading in a northwest direction with wind speeds of up to 183km per hour.

item.title: Low-carbon rice production helps Việt Nam meet emission target
item.description: Rice, which is Việt Nam’s most important crop and grown on more than half of its agricultural land area, accounts for 48 per cent of the agriculture sector’s GHG emissions and over 75 per cent of methane emissions.

item.title: Farmers save wild birds and the environment
item.description: Farmers in different provinces throughout Việt Nam have for years spent time and effort to save wild birds, giving them a home to nest and lay eggs.

item.title: Bayer kicks off 2022 ‘Safe Use Ambassador’
item.description: Bayer Vietnam recently kicked off its ‘Safe Use Ambassador Initiative’ (SUA) in the form of a contest for agricultural students at the College of Agriculture - Can Tho University and University of Agriculture and Forestry - Hue University.

item.title: Việt Nam views green tourism as sustainable development direction
item.description: Defined to become a key economic sector, Việt Nam’s tourism industry depends much on the natural environment. Therefore, for sustainable development of tourism, it is inevitably to follow the direction of green tourism.

item.title: Central Quảng Nam Province speeds up carbon credit export plan
item.description: The pilot plan of exporting 2.5 million carbon credits for an amount of VNĐ110 billion (US$4.7 million) to VNĐ130 billion ($5.6 million) per year from 2021-25 has been agreed upon by the government from 2021.

item.title: PM calls for global approach, int'l solidarity against climate change
item.description: Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính called for a global approach, and international solidarity in response to climate change in his message to the informal Leaders' Roundtable on Climate Change in New York, co-chaired by UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres and Egyptian President on Thursday.

item.title: Đồng Tháp works to conserve red-headed cranes
item.description: The red-headed crane is a symbolic species of Tràm Chim National Park

item.title: Vietnamese scientist helps revive Ottawa sand dunes
item.description: The Pinhey Sand Dunes were mostly covered by non-native pine trees, causing habitat degradation.

item.title: International partners commit to help VN realising net zero emissions
item.description: The United Nations and development partners, during discussions with Vietnamese ministries and sectors, expressed their willingness to support Việt Nam in achieving the goal of net zero emission and energy transition.

item.title: Mekong River Commission improves monitoring and flood forecasting
item.description: The Mekong River Basin supports nearly 70 million people, providing energy, transport, tourism and other income-generating development opportunities. As climate and weather patterns become more volatile, flood and drought events in the Mekong have become more frequent and intense with growing potential to cause devastating damage to the region’s food security and economies. Those communities that were unprepared have suffered the most.

item.title: Việt Nam to improve environmental quality
item.description: A recent report by the Ministry of Public Security said that climate change has become more complicated in recent years.

item.title: One missing after torrential rain across northern regions
item.description: Nguyễn Xuân Giang, 37, was swept away by flash floods on Thursday.

item.title: HCM City seeks investors for wastewater treatment projects
item.description: HCM City is calling for investment in six planned wastewater treatment projects to treat about three million cubic metres (m3) of wastewater a day in the city.

item.title: US wants to work with Việt Nam in climate change, energy transition
item.description: In talks with secretary of the HCM City Party Committee Nguyễn Văn Nên, John Kerry said that the US and Việt Nam had a good relationship in many areas and needed to strengthen cooperation to quickly to combat climate change.

item.title: US Special Presidential Envoy for Climate visits Mekong Delta province
item.description: John Kerry said Việt Nam, including Bến Tre Province, has the advantage to develop wind and solar energy, adding that this will be an advantage for both countries to work together in the future.

item.title: Specific guidelines for waste separation at source should be issued soon
item.description: Managerial agencies should soon issue specific guidelines for localities to effectively apply separation of domestic solid waste at source following the Government's Decree No. 45/2022/NĐ-CP on sanctioning of administrative violations in the field of environment.

item.title: Joint emergency response to prevent imminent extinction of Asian ‘unicorn’
item.description: The saola, one of the world’s rarest animals, is getting a critical emergency boost from the European Union, Re:wild and WWF-Viet Nam to prevent its extinction.

item.title: Major irrigation system suffering serious pollution
item.description: The pollution has become a big concern and has resulted in serious consequences to people's lives, production and the environment.

item.title: Project helps strengthen Mekong Delta’s resilience against climate change
item.description: The project has been jointly launched by the Netherlands Development Organisation (SNV), the Vietnamese Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, and the German Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action.

item.title: HCM City youth embrace green living
item.description: Swapping batteries for plants, cleaning waste at markets or refilling cosmetics are just some of the examples of young people engaging in environmental protection in Hồ Chí Minh City.

item.title: Waste treatment exhibition opens in Đà Nẵng
item.description: More than 2,000 participants, researchers, businesses and visitors joined a waste treatment and environmental technology exhibition focusing on updated sustainable treatment solutions at the Đà Nẵng’s exhibition centre on August 25.

item.title: Storm Maon causes heavy rain, gusts in northeastern region
item.description: The National Steering Committee for Natural Disaster Prevention and Control issued an official document on responding to the effects of the storm.

item.title: Storm No 3 to cause rough weather in northern provinces
item.description: According to the National Center for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting, at 4am this morning, the center of storm No. 3 was about 290 km east of China's Leizhou Peninsula, with maximum wind speeds of 117 kph.

item.title: New regulation on sorting trash hopes to improve waste management
item.description: Representative of the Waste Management Department under the General Department of Environment noted that domestic solid waste is separated based on treatment requirements and into three groups: reusable and recyclable waste; food waste and other domestic solid waste.

item.title: Water conservation programme for three river basins launched
item.description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, in cooperation with WWF-Viet Nam, HEINEKEN Vietnam and local partners, has launched a partnership programme for water conservation in the basins of the Hồng (Red), Đồng Nai and Tiền River.

item.title: Motorbikes not meeting emissions standards to be restricted in Hà Nội from 2024
item.description: From 2026, vehicles with three to five years of use or more must undergo periodic emissions inspection, and the vehicles that do not meet emissions standards in the zoned area will be restricted from traffic.

item.title: Pilot project collects used beverage cartons
item.description: A programme to collect and recycle used beverage cartons will be piloted in HCM City from August 2022 to March 2023.

item.title: Central Highlands Province Kon Tum suffers consecutive earthquakes
item.description: Three consecutive earthquakes hit Kon Plong District this afternoon, according to the Earthquake Information and Tsunami Warning Centre of the Institute of Geophysics.

item.title: Experts outline carbon-neutral road map
item.description: Considering the effects of carbon dioxide on the global climate and environment, becoming carbon-neutral is increasingly seen by governments as an urgent task to achieve sustainable development, the 11th Congress of the Asian Association of Environmental and Resource Economics heard.

item.title: Việt Nam’s mainland may be hit by 3-5 storms from now to early 2023
item.description: There will be 8-10 storms and tropical depressions in the South China Sea from now to February 2023, of which from three to five storms are likely to directly affect Việt Nam’s mainland, according to the National Centre for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting.

item.title: Revived mangroves provide protection for residents
item.description: To people living in the coastal areas, mangroves serve as the ‘green walls’ that protect them from storms and typhoons.

item.title: Quảng Ninh refutes allegations of sea encroachment in Hạ Long Bay
item.description: The image circulated online was taken in Ao Tiên high-class tourism urban area project in Vân Đồn District, not Hạ Long Bay

item.title: City businesses told to prepare for extended responsibilities on environment
item.description: Manufacturers and importers in HCM City need to be ready to take on extended producer responsibilities for their products’ environmental impacts, including recycling and treating toxic wastes, a top Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment official has said.

item.title: Coca Cola joins locals in Đà Nẵng in “For a Việt Nam without Waste” programme
item.description: The event, joined by representatives from agencies and the local community, is one of the activities organised by Coca-Cola Vietnam and local authorities in Đà Nẵng and HCM City under the "World Without a Waste" vision.

item.title: Việt Nam strives to conserve endangered elephant species
item.description: Since 2012, August 12 is recognised as World Elephant Day. World Elephant Day has become an opportunity for everyone to raise awareness about elephant protection and seek solutions to reduce conflicts between elephants and humans; as well as efforts to preserve this species in the wild.

item.title: Bryde whales spotted off south-central Vietnamese coast
item.description: Locals and photographers from across the country were thrilled by the appearance of Bryde whales in Đề Gi sea, Phú Cát District, Bình Định Province in recent days.

item.title: Heavy rain causes flooding, traffic disruptions in Hà Nội, northern localities
item.description: Prolonged downpours have flooded many areas and caused traffic chaos on many streets.

item.title: Mekong Delta floods to be below normal this year: authorities
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta is expected to have less flooding than normal this year, according to the Directorate of Water Resources.

item.title: Đắk Lắk Province authorities look for ways to protect the region's elephant number
item.description: Đắk Lắk Province is seeking to protect elephants in the province and Central Highland region amid overhunting and conflicts between the animals and people.

item.title: Environment ministry applauded for achievements on 20th anniversary
item.description: Speaking at the ceremony to mark MoNRE's 20th anniversary, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính said that environmental resources are an indispensable factor for human survival and development, as well as the sustainable development of the country.

item.title: Green, circular and eco-friendly economy is Việt Nam's priority for environmental protection
item.description: Việt Nam's top priority in the coming years is building a roadmap, mechanism and policy for the formation and operation of a green, circular and eco-friendly economy, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment has said.

item.title: JICA-funded project helps Đà Nẵng enhance waste classification at source
item.description: Đà Nẵng is striving to reuse and recycle 15 per cent of solid waste by 2025.

item.title: Green finance necessary to achieve sustainable growth: experts
item.description: Việt Nam will need to develop capital markets to achieve its sustainable development goals, panelists said at a forum on green economy development held on July 29 in HCM City.

item.title: Solar-powered cameras proposed in Hòn Mun for coral protection
item.description: Nha Trang City People's Committee has proposed to install solar-powered cameras to monitor and protect coral in Hòn Mun Area after severe coral bleaching was reported.

item.title: National Strategy on Climate Change for 2050 approved
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Lê Văn Thành has approved the National Strategy on Climate Change for 2050.

item.title: Việt Nam, US hold fourth energy security dialogue
item.description: Representatives of the two sides presented key issues in bilateral energy cooperation including clean electricity production, electricity market development, energy saving and efficiency, transmission and energy storage.

item.title: Tasks, solutions set out to fulfil Việt Nam's COP26 commitments
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Lê Văn Thành on Monday signed a decision approving the project on tasks and solutions to implement the outcomes of the 26th United Nations Climate Change Conference of the Parties (COP26).

item.title: Việt Nam's largest waste-to-energy plant hooks up to national grid
item.description: The Sóc Sơn waste-to-energy project was approved by Hà Nội’s authorities in late 2017 with a total investment of VNĐ7 trillion (US$303 million).

item.title: Đồng Tháp promotes environmental protection among farmers
item.description: The southern province of Đồng Tháp is promoting the reuse of packaging used to contain insecticide.

item.title: Measures needed to preserve Nha Trang Bay corals
item.description: Swimming and diving have been banned in part of Nha Trang Bay, one of Việt Nam’s most beautiful coastal destinations. The suspension is a result of concerns over damage to the coral reef.

item.title: Waste map to help Việt Nam turn waste into resources
item.description: A webinar on measures to optimise the exploitation of solid waste potential in Việt Nam in order to turn waste into resources, was held by the Vietnam Initiative for Energy Transition (VIETSE) on Tuesday, bringing together experts, and representatives from environment organisations and development partners.

item.title: Reef recovery
item.description: Considered as the tropical forest underwater, coral reef plays an important role in marine life. In part of the water off Nha Trang beach, the reef is dying at an alarming rate. Local authorities have ordered a ban of swimming and diving off Mun Island to investigate the cause and work on viable solutions to breathe new life into the coral.

item.title: Massive whale carcass washed ashore in Quảng Ninh
item.description: According to local fishermen, when being found in the morning of Monday, the whale, weighing about 5-7 tonnes, was in the process of decomposition and giving off a strong smell.

item.title: Bình Định to improve waste management with international funded
item.description: Bình Định south-central coastal province will have action plans to improve solid waste and plastic management to reduce marine plastic pollution, Chairman of Bình Định Province People's Committee, Nguyễn Phi Long has said.

item.title: Fines set for not sorting trash
item.description: Starting August 25, a fine of up to VNĐ1 million (US$42.8) can be applied to households that do not sort domestic waste per regulations.

item.title: Waste treatment enterprises ask for financial support
item.description: Waste treatment enterprises in Hà Nội are suffering losses and are at risk of bankruptcy due to high petrol and oil prices, not only putting their businesses in jeopardy but creating the risk of waste not being collected.

item.title: Đắk Lắk to use GPS tracking necklaces to monitor wild elephants
item.description: The International Organisation for Nature Conservation in Việt Nam and Đắk Lắk Province are working on a GPS tracking system to help with elephant conservation in the province.

item.title: HCM City eyes advanced waste-management technologies
item.description: The HCM City Department of Natural Resources and Environment is promoting the application of advanced technologies in waste management in order to manage effectively large amounts of waste generated in the city.

item.title: Storm Chaba weakens into tropical depression
item.description: The National Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting Centre reported at 1am on Sunday that the No.1 storm (Chaba) has weakened into a tropical depression.

item.title: Traditional markets slow to use environmentally friendly plastic bags
item.description: Traditional markets have been slow to embrace the use of environmentally friendly bags.

item.title: Tens of wild animals released back to nature
item.description: As many as 58 animals of eight species, including civet, king cobra, keeled box turtle, crested bird, cuckoo, yellow-billed starling, red-breasted parakeet, and Japanese zosterops, along with some cobras, were released back to Cúc Phương National Park on Saturday.

item.title: Prime Minister orders urgent actions in response to powerful storm Chaba
item.description: Chaba, the first tropical storm to hit the East Sea this year, is predicted to gain more strength and cause torrential rains in the northern region between July 2-7.

item.title: Green Sculpture event raise awareness of environment protection
item.description: A competition and exhibition called Green Sculpture is being held at Estella Place, Thủ Đức City to display sculptures made from recycled materials.

item.title: Việt Nam reaffirms commitments to develop blue, sustainable oceans
item.description: Vietnamese representatives reaffirmed their country’s commitments to develop blue and sustainable oceans when attending the United Nations Ocean Conference (UNOC) held in Lisbon from June 27 to July 1.

item.title: Bạc Liêu develops forests with sustainable programmes
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Bạc Liêu is speeding up afforestation and stepping up protection of existing forests.

item.title: National action plan for circular economy to be set up
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment on Tuesday chaired a conference to discuss a national action plan for Việt Nam's circular economy.

item.title: Better policies needed to develop ocean economy
item.description: Appropriate policies and regulations will help fully exploit untapped potential in developing the marine economy.

item.title: Australia to launch new Plastics Innovation Hub in Việt Nam
item.description: Australian scientists will deliver new innovations to tackle plastic waste in the Indo-Pacific, with a Plastics Innovation Hub being launched in Việt Nam, according to the Australian Embassy in Việt Nam.

item.title: World’s first zero-emission boat visits HCM City
item.description: Energy Observer – the world’s first hydrogen-powered, zero-emission vessel that is self-sufficient in energy – continues its journey in Southeast Asia, with the 73rd stopover of its round-the-world Odyssey being in HCM City, Việt Nam.

item.title: Trà Vinh Province grows forests to protect coasts, improve environment
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Trà Vinh is growing more forests and strengthening conservation of existing ones.

item.title: People in Quảng Ngãi down in the dumps over increasing amounts of waste
item.description: Large amounts of waste have been washing ashore n the southern central province of Quảng Ngãi recently, despite the best efforts of the community to keep the rubbish at bay.

item.title: Hòn Yến coral reefs badly damaged
item.description: As tourists return to Hòn Yến national scenic spot, their actions are also damaging the coral reefs

item.title: Workshop seeks to promote responsible tourism and wildlife conservation
item.description: Preventing tourists from buying ivory products and endangered wild species is essential, especially in the context of Việt Nam having fully reopened its doors to international tourists, a workshop held in Hà Nội on Wednesday heard.

item.title: Dive tourism suspension planned to protect coral reefs in Nha Trang Bay
item.description: The south-central province of Khánh Hoà is planning to suspend dive tourism in vulnerable coral reef areas in Nha Trang Bay due to serious reef degradation.

item.title: VN plants trees for World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought
