item.description: Việt Nam has made strong efforts to combat land degradation and improve livelihoods for people contributing to sustainable forestry development, said deputy director of the General Department of Forestry Phạm Văn Điển.

item.title: Support from other countries key to fighting climate change
item.description: Việt Nam has joined the race to a net-zero economy by 2050 as it was among more than 40 countries that agreed to shift away from coal, one of the biggest generators of CO2 emissions, in pledges made at the COP26 climate summit.

item.title: Nha Trang scrambles to save coral reefs from bleaching
item.description: Saving coral reefs in Nha Trang Bay Marine Protected Area from massive bleaching is a priority that requires a long-term, scientific and sustainable strategy, scientists and oceanographers have said.

item.title: Engineers complete maintenance on island desalination system
item.description: Engineers and workers from Korean heavy industry Doosan Enerbility Vietnam (Doosan Vina) have completed maintenance of two seawater desalination plants to supply enough fresh water for islanders in An Binh islet of Lý Sơn Islands.

item.title: More needs to be done in Asia to fully unleash its renewable energy potential: MoNRE
item.description: The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment on Wednesday sent a message, highlighting seven focus points to fully unleash Asia’s potential for renewable energy development.

item.title: USAID launches Species Conservation Fund in Việt Nam
item.description: The United State Agency for International Development (USAID) Biodiversity Conservation Activity has launched a $1.4 million Species Conservation Fund (SCF) in Việt Nam

item.title: Unilever Vietnam launches “Clean Future” campaign
item.description: In response to the World Environment Day, Unilever Vietnam has launched the "Clean Future" campaign from its Home Care category on June 14.

item.title: Northern, central regions enter prolonged rainy spell
item.description: The northern and central regions have entered a period of prolonged heavy rain, according to the National Centre for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting.

item.title: USAID and agriculture ministry launches project to combat wildlife trafficking
item.description: The Saving Threatened Wildlife project aims to help Việt Nam control the increasingly serious wildlife trafficking situation.

item.title: E-waste collection at a standstill in Hà Nội
item.description: The collection of used batteries in Hà Nội is currently at a standstill due to various problems.

item.title: Government, partners discuss mangrove afforestation in Mekong Delta
item.description: Local authorities and experts from international organisations and partners discussed measures to increase the mangrove restoration and afforestation in Việt Nam’s Mekong Delta region at a workshop held in Hà Nội on Friday.

item.title: Endangered stork flock to southern Việt Nam
item.description: More than 1,000 Asian openbills, an endangered species in Việt Nam, are gathering at a savanna called Tà Nốt inside the Lò Gò-Xa Mát National Park in the southeastern province of Tây Ninh, according to the national park’s director Châu Văn Văn.

item.title: More effort needed on plastic ocean waste: experts
item.description: A conference was held in Hà Nội on Wednesday to discuss efforts and measures to reduce ocean plastic waste, marking World Oceans Day (June 8).

item.title: USAID, KOICA signed MOU on cooperation on climate change, environment protection in Việt Nam
item.description: The US Agency for International Development (USAID) and the Korea International Cooperation Agency (KOICA) on Wednesday signed the first Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the two agencies in Việt Nam on cooperation to reduce pollution, mitigate climate change in the Mekong Delta, and accelerate the transition to clean energy in Việt Nam.

item.title: More grey-shanked douc langurs found in Quảng Nam's Hòn Dồ Mountain
item.description: A total of 68 grey-shanked douc langurs are living in Hòn Dồ mountain area, Quảng Nam Province. The primates were found after an assessment of the area in Tam Mỹ Tây commune , Núi Thành District.

item.title: Kiên Giang Province’s sea, river erosion prevention plans
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Kiên Giang plans to build 200 erosion prevention works along its coasts and rivers by 2030.

item.title: 5-million-euro sustainable landscape project set for Central Highlands
item.description: A project to strengthen integrated sustainable landscape management through a deforestation-free jurisdiction in Central Highlands Lâm Đồng and Đắk Nông provinces was launched on Friday.

item.title: Two endangered animals handed to national park
item.description: Two critically endangered animals have been put under the protection of Cúc Phương National Park in the northern province of Ninh Bình after they were found near residential areas

item.title: Carbon pricing a low-cost solution to reduce GHG emissions in Việt Nam: official
item.description: In a recent interview with Sài Gòn Giải Phóng (Liberated Sài Gòn) newspaper, head of the Climate Change Department under the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment Tăng Thế Cường talks about the potentials of implementing carbon pricing in Việt Nam in its efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: The pioneer in the fight against climate change
item.description: As climate change poses a real threat to the global ecosystem’s sustainability, Unilever Vietnam (UVN) has set out a range of targets and courses of action to take the lead in the fight against climate change.

item.title: Calls for Hà Nội to prohibit breeding bears for bile at individual facilities
item.description: A group of organisations on Monday proposed some solutions to Hà Nội authorities for the protection of bears from exploitation in the capital.

item.title: Rare primates turn up in Thanh Hóa nature reserve
item.description: Five rare primate species were discovered in the Pù Hu Nature Reserve in the central province of Thanh Hoá.

item.title: Government takes action to protect wild birds
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Lê Văn Thành signed a directive to protect migratory and wild birds in Việt Nam.

item.title: Activities calling for environmental protection efforts launched
item.description: Activities calling for environmental protection efforts were rolled out during an event held in Tiên Yên District of the north-eastern province of Quảng Ninh on Saturday.

item.title: Ministry urges conservation of groundwater resources
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment has called on provinces and cities nationwide to step up conservation of groundwater resources.

item.title: Urgent action needed on primate protection
item.description: However, a report by ENV, an NGO focused on wildlife protection, showed that only 30 per cent of total poaching violations in Việt Nam were discovered, while 70 per cent were unknown, meaning that the number of the langurs hunted in the forest was unclear.

item.title: Fencer, volunteers collects rubbish in Mỹ Đình Gymnasium
item.description: Famed fencer Vũ Thành An and nearly 100 volunteers collected plastic rubbish in Mỹ Đình Gymnasium on Friday, in the “Collecting Plastic Rubbish – Getting Green Medals” activity as part of the ongoing 'For A Green SEA Games' campaign.

item.title: Hà Nội needs to combine green growth with urban development
item.description: The capital Hà Nội is focusing on urban development towards green and sustainable growth and building a smart and modern city.

item.title: Việt Nam joins efforts to restore ecosystems
item.description: Việt Nam is joining common efforts to restore ecosystems in response to International Day for Biological Diversity 2022 (May 22) themed “Building a shared future for all life”.

item.title: Localities to strengthen forest management, protection
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Lê Văn Thành has asked ministries and localities to strengthen forest management and protection, deal with illegal deforestation and encroachment on forest land.

item.title: Việt Nam has huge potential for saving energy: experts
item.description: For a developing society and economy like Việt Nam’s, energy is the engine behind growth, especially in the post-pandemic recovery.

item.title: Vietnamese students champion int’l environmental competition
item.description: Three high school students brought home US$100,000 from the Earth Prize competition, an initiative of the Switzerland-based Earth Foundation that encourages students to address environmental issues.

item.title: Microplastic pollution found in Đà Nẵng air
item.description: Microplastic pollution in the air in both inner and suburban areas of the central city of Đà Nẵng has become serious. Microplastics can go directly into the lungs during daily activities.

item.title: Climate change, pollution hamper sustainable ocean economy
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Lê Văn Thành called on countries to make strong commitments and take drastic and effective measures to demonstrate the responsibility of each country for the sustainable development of the ocean economy.

item.title: Campaign launched for plastic-free SEA Games
item.description: The hashtags #Seagamesnoplastic and #Greensport are part of a campaign launched during the 31st Southeast Asian Games to raise public awareness of environmental protection, according to Games organisers.

item.title: Project launched to support Việt Nam to spur energy efficiency
item.description: Using energy economically and efficiently is a practical solution to help ensure national energy security, develop the economy, protect the environment and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: EU’s experience in transition to green economy shared with Việt Nam
item.description: A webinar to share experience and ideas of transition to a green economy of Europe countries through the European Green Agreement (EGA) gathered participants from Hà Nội, central Đà Nẵng City and central Thừa Thiên – Huế Province.

item.title: Concerns raised as Central Highlands Province sees spike in earthquakes
item.description: Kon Tum Province had 33 earthquakes from 1903 to 2020, but has seen 169 since last year

item.title: National power development plan VIII targets drastic CO2 emissions reduction
item.description: The latest draft National Power Development Plan for the 2021 - 2030 period, with a vision to 2045 (PDP VIII) has made drastic reduction of CO2 emissions with no new coal-fired power plants to be built in the planning period, and with the switch from coal and natural gas to biomass, ammonia, and hydrogen, according to Deputy Minister of Industry and Trade Đặng Hoàng An.

item.title: Informal female workers key to waste management
item.description: The informal sector plays a pivotal role in Việt Nam's solid waste management system as over 30 per cent of the waste is estimated to be collected through this channel

item.title: Đồng Nai forest supported in elephant protection
item.description: The Forest Protection Department in the southern province of Đồng Nai on Friday received equipment including 10 cameras and 60 camera traps to better manage and protect elephants in the province.

item.title: Việt Nam to become model of inclusive, green growth: UNDP Representative
item.description: Việt Nam has the opportunity to develop a pathway for inclusive, green growth that others can learn from, United Nations Development Programme Resident Representative Caitlin Wiesen has said.

item.title: Seven rescued Indochinese tiger cubs given new lease of life
item.description: Seven baby Indochinese tigers, who were rescued from wildlife traffickers in the central province of Nghệ An in August 2021, are growing stronger every day thanks to the special care of the staff at the Wildlife Centre of Pù Mát National Park over the last eight months.

item.title: Integrated plan a good start to tackle Mekong Delta woes
item.description: An integrated master plan for the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta region, the nation’s agriculture and aquaculture hub, is a good step towards tackling several major challenges facing the region, especially climate change.

item.title: HCM City to build on environmental breakthroughs, improve life quality
item.description: Greater public awareness and action, especially in classifying garbage at source, is a breakthrough that HCM City will build on to environment quality in the coming decade.

item.title: National plan for natural disaster prevention and control released
item.description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) has coordinated with relevant ministries, sectors and localities to build a national plan for natural disaster prevention and control to 2025.

item.title: Ninh Thuận all charged up over renewable potential
item.description: When the nuclear power plants planned in the province were cancelled, Ninh Thuận quickly retrained its focus on becoming a renewable energy hub, utilizing its natural strengths.

item.title: Vegetable straws proving a hit around the world
item.description: With knowledge and experience gained from a decade working in Korea, a Hanoian man started a business producing straws made from vegetables and fruits.

item.title: Drastic measures needed to ensure water security: MoNRE
item.description: More drastic and comprehensive measures are needed to improve the efficiency of water resources and ensure water security, especially clean water supply to serve production and daily-life needs of people, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment has said.

item.title: Việt Nam to preserve vulnerable wildlife amid climate change
item.description: Scientists have studied, evaluated and predicted the impact of climate change on wildlife species in Việt Nam.

item.title: Việt Nam attends 8th Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue
item.description: Deputy Minister of Industry and Trade Đặng Hoàng Ân has attended the eighth Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue held in Berlin, Germany, under the motto “From Ambition to Action”.

item.title: Elderly people encouraged to take part in environment protection
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment and the Việt Nam Association of the Elderly have committed to coordinate in building green models with the participation of elderly people to better protect the environment.

item.title: Pesticide guidelines released
item.description: The Plant Protection Department under the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development and the CropLife Việt Nam Association have released a series of videos giving instructions on how to use pesticides safely, efficiently and responsibly.

item.title: Residents struggle to live with polluted water
item.description: Just on the outskirts of the capital city, the people of Tân Minh Commune in Sóc Sơn District have struggled for decades with polluted water.

item.title: World Meteorological Day 2022 stresses importance of early warning, early action
item.description: Themed “Early Warning and Early Action”, the World Meteorological Day 2022 (March 23) spotlighted the vital importance of hydrometeorological and climate information for disaster risk reduction.

item.title: Thanh Hóa women turn trash into money
item.description: Combining environmental protection with philanthropy, women in Thanh Hóa have been turning littered waste into money to buy tens of thousands of gifts for poor people.

item.title: World Water Day 2022 urges greater attention to groundwater
item.description: The theme of this year’s World Water Day on March 22 is “Groundwater”, the hidden water resource that is critically important but not always fully recognised in sustainable development policymaking.

item.title: Erosion worsening along Mekong Delta rivers, coast
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta is facing severe erosion along its rivers and coast, affecting people’s lives and agriculture.

item.title: Women play a crucial role in climate and environmental sectors: UNDP Representative
item.description: On the threshold of the 66th Commission on the Status of Women which opens on March 14, UNDP Resident Representative in Việt Nam Caitlin Wiesen, spoke about women's role in climate action.

item.title: Hội An aims to be ‘zero plastic waste’ destination
item.description: The International Union for Conservation of Nature, the centre for Supporting Green Development and PRO Việt Nam have donated 54 ‘green houses’ (dust bins made from reform plastic) and waste classification tools to Hội An City’s women’s union for boosting recycling and zero plastic waste in the community.

item.title: Việt Nam must scale-up budget for climate change adaptation
item.description: Việt Nam increased its public expenditure for climate change in 2016-2020, however, more investment is needed to address climate risks and to mobilise more support from international and private sources, according to experts at a workshop held on Friday.

item.title: WWF and partners to scale climate solutions for global impact
item.description: A five-year project to transform Việt Nam’s private sector toward sustainable energy use has been officially launched in southern Tây Ninh City.

item.title: Quảng Bình fishermen work to protect marine environment
item.description: Fishermen in the central coastal province of Quảng Bình take rubbish bags during their long sea trips to bring garbage back to land instead of discharging it to the ocean.

item.title: New law promotes awareness of environmental protection
item.description: The 2020 Law on Environmental Protection, which took effect at the beginning of 2022, has timely institutionalised many new policies of the Party and State related to environmental protection.

item.title: More lakes needed for the capital, not less
item.description: Architect Trần Huy Ánh spoke to VietNamNet online newspaper about the importance of natural ponds and lakes as Hà Nội's bodies of water are being filled in to make way for real estate development.

item.title: Saltwater intrusion damage successfully prevented this season: Mekong Delta
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta provinces say they have taken effective measures to mitigate saltwater intrusion impacts in the ongoing dry season.

item.title: Public-Private collaboration tackles plastic waste in Việt Nam
item.description: Despite being affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, the Plastic Waste Management Public-Private Collaboration has implemented activities in line with key tasks and seen several achievements over the past two years.

item.title: Dialogue focuses on helping women adapt to climate change
item.description: Delegates to a policy dialogue jointly held by the Vietnam Women’s Union (VWU) and the UN Women in Hà Nội on Monday discussed the effect of climate change on women's livelihoods.

item.title: Standard Chartered Vietnam launches carbon-neutral cards
item.description: Standard Chartered Bank has become the first bank to launch carbon-neutral credit and debit cards in Việt Nam. All new cards issued in Việt Nam will now be part of the carbon-neutral programme developed with Thales, the bank’s card manufacturing partner.

item.title: Waste sorting at home: a little act with a big impact
item.description: According to the law, daily-life solid waste collection and transport establishments have the right to refuse to collect and transport solid wastes of households and individuals that do not separate them by type or fail to use the correct packaging, and notify the competent authority for inspection and handling in accordance with the law.

item.title: Frost covers northern region after cold snap
item.description: Some provinces up north are covered in frost again after a cold snap occurred over the weekend.

item.title: Frost bites
Việt Nam considers setting up renewable energy centre to realise net-zero carbon commitment
item.description: The Ministry of Industry and Trade (MoIT) has been asked to coordinate with the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE) on setting up a renewable energy centre.

item.title: Phong Nha-Kẻ Bàng Park plans to become central region’s biodiversity conservation centre
item.description: The People’s Committee of the central province of Quảng Bình has approved a project to support the work of wildlife rescue, conservation and release at the Center for Rescue, Conservation and Creature Development in the Phong Nha-Kẻ Bàng National Park.

item.title: Project approved to improve forest protection capacity
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Lê Văn Thành has approved a 10-year project to improve forest rangers’ capacity in management, protection and firefighting.

item.title: Việt Nam joins the Southeast Asia Disaster Risk Insurance Facility
item.description: The Ministry of Finance, acting under Government authority, has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to become the eighth member of the Southeast Asia Disaster Risk Insurance Facility (SEADRIF).

item.title: National biodiversity strategy approved
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Lê Văn Thành has approved the national biodiversity strategy to 2030.

item.title: More cold spells expected to hit north, north central regions
item.description: The north and north central regions are forecast to see more strong cold spells in the first 10 days of February, which will cause temperatures to plunge, according to the National Centre for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting.

item.title: Ninh Thuận set to grow more coastal forests for protection, green cover
item.description: The south - central province of Ninh Thuận is growing coastal forests to minimise the effects of natural disasters while also increasing green cover.

item.title: 91 new species discovered in Việt Nam in 2020: WWF
item.description: Nguyễn Văn Trí Tín, biodiversity conservation lead of WWF-Việt Nam, said that with the new discoveries “Việt Nam is definitely one of the places full of potential for research and discovery of new species.”

item.title: HCMC ward launches free waste disposable scheme
item.description: As Tết (Lunar New Year) approaches, many people are tidying and decorating their homes in preparation for the most important holiday of the year. Most Vietnamese people believe that a neat and clean house brings luck and happiness in the New Year.

item.title: Việt Nam and partners develop sustainable energy transition in Việt Nam
item.description: With the pandemic still complicated and natural disasters becoming more frequent and devastating, Việt Nam needs to focus on driving sustainable energy transition, according to the 4th High-Level Meeting of the Việt Nam Energy Partnership Group (VEPG)

item.title: Demise of the tiger
item.description: The Year of the Tiger is fast approaching but the big cats are on the brink of extinction in the wild in Vietnam. Currently, tigers are allowed to be raised in non-commercial farming facilities across the country, but experts say more action should be taken to protect this dying breed of big cat.

item.title: Rich primate species in Việt Nam threatened: WWF report
item.description: About 25 different primate species found in Việt Nam out of total 44 call the Greater Mekong home, but these unique species are increasingly threatened by habitat loss and fragmentation, climate change, and hunting driven by consumption and the illegal trade.

item.title: Endangered turtles returned to wild
item.description: The Chàm Island’s Marine Protected Area (MPA) management board and Quảng Nam provincial rangers have released an endangered turtle to the local forest, three days after it was captured by a local farmer and handed to the MPA.

item.title: Ice, snow reported on Mount Fansipan
item.description: Ice and snow have been spotted on Mount Fansipan, the highest mountain in Việt Nam, as a result of widespread rain and freezing temperatures early Friday.

item.title: Domestic waste fee to be charged based on volume
item.description: Solid waste classification at source and volume-based waste fee collection must be implemented by 2024, according to the roadmap of the new Environment Law which took effect on January 1, 2022.

item.title: Kiên Giang makes efforts to protect marine ecosystem
item.description: Environmental pollution, encroachment of coastal areas to build resorts, restaurants and other activities on the coast have degraded and destroyed marine ecosystems in many coastal and island areas in Phú Quốc, Kiên Giang Province.

item.title: Legal foundations sought for tiger conservation in Việt Nam
item.description: The Education for Nature Vietnam (ENV) on Monday organised a seminar on raising tigers for conservation efforts in Việt Nam.

item.title: Experts evaluate Việt Nam's eco-industrial park model
item.description: Experts from UNIDO and Việt Nam shared their knowledge to evaluate the eco-industrial park model according to the international framework, at a recent online workshop.

item.title: Rice pest identification app piloted in An Giang
item.description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development’s Plant Protection Department and the An Giang provincial Department of Agriculture and Rural Development on January 11 piloted an app that helps identify rice pests and diseases

item.title: Cúc Phương National Park receives rescued wild animals
item.description: The Cúc Phương National Park in the northern province of Ninh Bình said on Monday that it had just rescued a large number of wild animals including turtles, a masked palm civet, Chinese Water Dragons, and pangolins in Đà Nẵng City and Quảng Trị Province in the central region.

item.title: Quảng Ngãi residents keep homeland green
item.description: Bình Tân Phú Commune has 18 hectares of natural forest, including 3.7 hectares managed by local authority and the remaining cared for by local residents. For them, protecting the forest and trees is a deeply meaningful activity.

item.title: Mekong Delta authorities take measures to secure freshwater in upcoming dry season
item.description: Authorities in Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta provinces are taking measures to store water for irrigation and household use during the 2021-22 dry season.

item.title: Việt Nam, World Bank sign US$127mln credit agreement for climate change adaptation in Mekong Delta city
item.description: The Vietnamese Government and the World Bank (WB) have signed a US$126.9 million financing agreement to improve infrastructure, connectivity and reduce flood risks in the urban core of Vĩnh Long City in the Mekong Delta province of Vĩnh Long.

item.title: Environmental management innovation needed to reduce pollution
item.description: The environment is suffering great pressure from socio-economic activities with an increase in environmental pollution in both quantity and scale, calling for more effective solutions to handle the issue.

item.title: The 'crazy' man and the sea
item.description: Every time he goes out to catch seafood, Trần Văn Cường from Phú Vang District, Thừa Thiên - Huế Province, collects cans, plastic bottles and bags to raise money for poor students while contributing to the protection of the marine environment.

item.title: Mekong Delta urged to take measures to cope with drought and salt intrusion in 2022
item.description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development has issued a directive on the implementation of solutions to cope with drought and saltwater intrusion in the Mekong Delta, which is forecast to be harsh in the coming dry season.

item.title: Cúc Phương national park launches programme inspiring love for nature
item.description: Cúc Phương National Park kicked off an education programme on Thursday with a view to inspiring a love for nature in the community

item.title: Ninh Thuận promotes sustainable development in Núi Chúa national park marine protected area
item.description: Authorities of south central Ninh Thuận Province has strengthened measures to conserve endangered and rare species of marine fauna and flora, and sustainably restore and develop the ecosystem of the Núi Chúa National Park Marine Protected Area.

item.title: Save coral reefs in Ha Long Bay
item.description: The coral ecosystem of Hạ Long Bay suffers from strong human impacts such as water transportation, tourism, fishing, mineral exploitation, wastewater, etc. Quảng Ninh is working hard to protect its coral reef ecosystems.

item.title: HCMC struggles to implement motorbike emission checks
item.description: HCM City has been piloting a free-of-charge motorbike emission test to remove old and poor quality vehicles from the roads, reducing emissions into the air and improving environmental quality. However, there have been some bumps in the road.

item.title: Cà Mau steps up natural disaster prevention, control efforts
item.description: Cà Mau Province is taking measures to mitigate the impacts of increasing erosion and other natural disasters.

item.title: Protects the parts of Hạ Long Bay many people never see
item.description: Over the years, the large amount of boats carrying both tourists and fishermen has taken its toll on the coral reefs below the surface.

item.title: WWF Vietnam helps Long An in domestic solid waste management
item.description: WWF Vietnam will continue to help Long An Province in domestic solid waste management as the provincial authorities decide to expand a model of waste separation at source

item.title: Plastic and Health Action Partnership launched
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment co-ordinated with USAID to launch "Plastic and Health Action Partnership” (PHA) in Hà Nội on Friday.

enclosure.url: https://image.vietnamnews.vn/uploadvnnews/Article/2021/12/19/192120_Đại diện các tổ chức tuyên bố thành lập Đối tác Hành động về Nhựa và Sức khoẻ.png

item.title: Mekong fishermen struggle to survive
item.description: Our data-driven investigation shows that local communities in the Mekong Delta are struggling to find a way out, as fishing, their main livelihood, can no longer guarantee them a sustainable future.

item.title: Coastal provinces ban vessels from going to sea ahead of typhoon Rai
item.description: Coastal provinces have started to ban vessels going out to sea to ensure safety ahead of typhoon Rai.

item.title: Finding sustainable waste management solutions for Hà Nội
item.description: Hà Nội is one of the biggest and most modern cities in the country, but its waste treatment capacity does not match the growth of the city.

item.title: Việt Nam seeking environmental innovators to combat climate change
item.description: The competition "The Search for Innovative Models to Combat Climate Change and Reduce Damages from Natural Disasters" was announced on Thursday by the Directorate for Climate Change of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment.

item.title: Mekong Delta expands environmentally-friendly shrimp-rice farms
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta is expanding its shrimp – rice farming areas as the cultivation model is efficient and sustainable, adapts to climate change, and is environmentally friendly.

item.title: Tiền Giang secures water for dry season with sluices, dredging of channels
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Tiền Giang has taken measures to cope with saltwater intrusion in its rivers in the coming dry season to protect its rice, fruits and other crops and ensure households have water for daily use.

item.title: Stricter measures needed to protect wild animals
item.description: Illegal trafficking of wild animals remains a problem in Việt Nam despite the efforts of the Government and wildlife preservation organisations. There has been a decline in the number of many precious, rare and endemic species, putting many of them at risk of extinction.

item.title: Hội An to be Việt Nam’s first city to stop dog and cat meat consumption
item.description: The city is the first locality in Việt Nam to sign an agreement to end dog and cat meat trade.

item.title: Chàm Islands return two tortoises to nature
item.description: Two tortoises, one identified as a critically endangered species, have been returned to the sea off the Chàm Islands after being rescued by local people and the Chàm Island’s Marine Protected Area management board.

item.title: Joint action crucial for Mekong-Lancang river countries to overcome challenges: Vietnamese Minister
item.description: Only through joint and timely actions can the countries of the Mekong-Lancang river basin overcome the current challenges to protect common prosperity and culture, stated the Vietnamese Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Trần Hồng Hà.

item.title: Marine plastic waste an urgent issue in coastal Việt Nam
item.description: Việt Nam needs to carry out practical measures to manage and reduce marine plastic waste to ensure sustainable development of the fishery industry, according to experts at a workshop held in Hà Nội on Thursday.

item.title: Scuba diver spent nearly two decades cleaning up the ocean
item.description: Scuba diver Nguyễn Văn Đức is dedicated to cleaning the ocean and he hopes his work will inspire others to do the same.

item.title: Việt Nam Wind Power 2021 event launched
item.description: Việt Nam Wind Power 2021, an annual event since 2018, was launched in Hà Nội on Wednesday.

item.title: PM2.5 pollution still problematic across Việt Nam
item.description: Though the average PM2.5 concentration improved slightly in 2020, all provinces and cities in Việt Nam still had higher levels than WHO’s recommendation, according to data revealed at a workshop held virtually on Tuesday.

item.title: Vietnamese agriculture aims for green growth
item.description: Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development Lê Minh Hoan highlighted the need for Vietnamese agriculture to aim for “green values” created from “green transformation, green consumption, green economy".

item.title: Four people killed in flash floods
item.description: Four people have died after heavy rain and floods hit the central and central highlands regions over the past few days.

item.title: Endangered sea turtle returns to ocean
item.description: The Chàm Island’s Marine Protected Area (MPA) management board has released a hawksbill turtle (Eretmochelys Imbricata) – an endangered sea turtle species – back into the ocean after it was trapped in a drifting ‘ghost net' of garbage (a fishing net inadvertently lost overboard by fishermen) in the water off the islands.

item.title: Low-lying Mekong Delta deals with worsening land subsidence
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta region needs “consistent strategies” to deal with groundwater extraction, land subsidence and saltwater intrusion in an increasingly urbanising area, experts said at a conference in HCM City on November 26.

item.title: National park release wild animals back to nature
item.description: The thirty individuals released are among the 100 civets that were handed over to the park from Bắc Giang forest rangers and police in April. The animals were seized from an illegal wildlife trafficking case.

item.title: Rescued endangered pangolin released back into the wild
item.description: An endangered pangolin (Manis Javanica), rescued by local residents living on Cham Islands, has been returned to the wild.

item.title: Cúc Phương National Park receives two grey langurs
item.description: The Cúc Phương National Park in northern Ninh Bình Province recently received two rare grey langurs from Forest Protection Department of central Thánh Hóa Province, its official said on Wednesday.

item.title: Huế aims to be ‘zero plastic waste’ destination in 2030
item.description: Huế City, a tourism hub in central Việt Nam, aims to cut its plastic waste by 30 per cent before 2024 and will be a ‘zero plastic waste’ destination by 2030.

item.title: Webinar discusses solutions to ecosystem restoration in Việt Nam
item.description: Việt Nam needs to encourage and improve capacity and responsibility for the environment and nature and implement preventive actions in management agencies and businesses to minimise nature degradation, an expert has said.

item.title: Report on climate change in Việt Nam introduced at COP26
item.description: A report titled “Climate change in Viet Nam, Impacts and Adaptation” has been introduced within the framework of COP26 in Glasgow, UK.

item.title: First Delacour’s langur baby born at Ninh Binh's Tràng An Complex
item.description: A Delacour’s langur baby has been born after its parents were released into the wild last year on Ngọc Island in Tràng An Landscape Complex, the northern province of Ninh Bình.

item.title: $4 billion investment in climate change response announced at COP26 Summit
item.description: This includes $4 billion in investments to accelerate innovation for climate-smart agriculture and food systems over the next five years.

item.title: Endangered black-shanked doucs spotted in Tây Ninh
item.description: Two to three families of endangered black-shanked doucs, each having about two or three individuals, have been spotted in Bà Đen Mountain national tourist complex in the southwestern province of Tây Ninh since May.

item.title: Việt Nam strives to achieve ‘net zero’ by 2050, with international support: PM
item.description: Vietnamese Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính has called on countries to make strong commitments to reduce greenhouse emissions on the basis of common responsibility that suit their conditions and capacity, adding that there should be fairness and justice in climate change issues.

item.title: Landslides injure one, block many roads in Điện Biên, Lai Châu
item.description: Landslides, triggered by torrential rain, were reported on Sunday night and early Monday morning, injuring one woman and causing a house to collapse in the northern mountainous province of Điện Biên.

item.title: ‘One Million Trees Plantation’ project resumes after COVID-19
item.description: The 'One Million Trees Plantation' project, delayed by COVID-19, has resumed in the Phước Trường communal house park. It is the fourth park in Đà Nẵng that has had trees planted in, to provide a ‘green’ shadow for the community and to reduce air pollution.

item.title: Việt Nam's active role in climate change to be highlighted at COP 26
item.description: Vietnamese Ambassador to the UK, Nguyễn Hoàng Long, talks with Vietnam News Agency about Việt Nam's role in dealing with climate change, as Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính prepares for the UN-Climate Change Conference COP26 in the UK.

item.title: Norway hands over offshore wind report to VN
item.description: On the 50th anniversary of Vietnamese and Norwegian diplomatic relations, a 70-page Norwegian report on offshore wind production in Việt Nam was presented to officials on Thursday afternoon. It provides an overview of the entire supply chain for Việt Nam’s offshore wind industry.

item.title: Local communities lend a hand to forest protection
item.description: Kon Ka Kinh National Park, located in the Kon Hà Nừng Plateau Biosphere Reserve, the Central Highlands province of Gia Lai, is being protected thanks to the engagement of the local ethnic minority community.

item.title: Endangered turtle released back to sea in Quảng Bình
item.description: After being found tangled in a fishing net, a rare and endangered turtle was released back into the sea off Quảng Bình on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Trading scraps for groceries
item.description: As a means to promote environmental protection while supporting the community through the pandemic, grocery stalls in Văn Miếu Ward, Đống Đa District, Hà Nội are letting people trade scraps for food.

item.title: USAID-funded Mekong Delta Coastal Habitat Conservation project launched
item.description: A workshop took place both virtually and in-person in Hà Nội on Thursday to launch the Mekong Delta Coastal Habitat Conservation project, which was announced during US Vice President Kamala Harris’s visit to Việt Nam in August.

item.title: Investigation launched to find killers of endangered langurs in Quảng Ngãi
item.description: The grey-shanked douc langur is listed on the International Union for Conservation of Nature red list as one of the world’s 25 most critically endangered primates. The primates can only be found in Việt Nam.

item.title: Climate-Smart Maps and Adaptation Plans (CS-MAP) launched
item.description: To help farmers manage climate-related risks such as flooding, drought and saline intrusion, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development launched the Climate-Smart Maps and Adaption Plans (CS-MAP) on Tuesday.

item.title: Torrential rain to hit the northern, central region from Wednesday
item.description: Torrential rain, triggered by typhoon Kompasu, will blanket the northern and central regions from Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Việt Nam to plant extra 20,000ha coastal forest to cope with climate change
item.description: Việt Nam will plant a 20,000ha forest as part of a project to protect and develop coastal forests in response to climate change and to push green growth over the next 10 years.

item.title: Việt Nam aims for safe treatment of 100 per cent solid waste in 2050
item.description: The Vietnamese Government has set a goal to raise the rate of solid waste collected and safely treated to 100 per cent in 2050 as part of the freshly approved national strategy on green growth for 2021-2030.

item.title: Measures in place to deal with serious storms
item.description: Experts discussed measures to cope with current bad weather during a conference on Sunday as heavy rain battered the northeast and another storm was forecast to enter the East Sea.

item.title: ASEAN highlights the urgency of fossil fuel reduction and low carbon economy development
item.description: The 8th ASEAN Ministerial Meeting on Minerals (AMMin 8) opened in the form of teleconference in Hà Nội on Friday, highlighting the urgency of developing the circular, low carbon economy and reducing the use of fossil fuels.

item.title: Việt Nam chooses sustainable approach to development: Minister
item.description: Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Trần Hồng Hà affirmed that Việt Nam chooses the sustainable and active approach to development in the direction of green and circular economy while addressing the fourth Forum of Ministers and Environment Authorities of Asia Pacific yesterday.

item.title: Endangered pangolin released to nature of Chàm Islands
item.description: Local rangers and management of the Chàm Island Maritime Protected Area (MPA) have released an endangered pangolin (Manis Javanica) back to the wild on the Chàm Islands after locals found the animal.

item.title: More than 100,000 hectare acres of rubber plantations in VN to get sustainable forest management certificates this year
item.description: PEFC is the largest forest certification system in the world and the certification system of choice for small forest owners, with more than 300 million hectares represented across 49 nations.

item.title: Typhoon Dianmu weakens to tropical depression
item.description: Central Việt Nam experienced strong winds and heavy rain after Typhoon Dianmu made landfall in provinces from Thừa Thiên-Huế to Quảng Nam, weakening to a tropical depression on Friday morning.

item.title: Sanofi Vietnam inks deal to switch to rice husk fuel for boilers from diesel
item.description: Sanofi Vietnam and Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit’s Climate Protection through Sustainable Bioenergy Market in Vietnam Project are collaborating to convert diesel boilers at the former's factories into rice husk-fired ones to cut down the amount of waste and air pollution.

item.title: Việt Nam improves the legality of imported timber
item.description: Germany's International Co-operation Agency (GIZ) launched an e-training course on the due diligence system (DDS) for timber imports into Việt Nam, promoting principles of due diligence and its application in business activities of timber operators.

item.title: Việt Nam ready to join talks on global treaty on marine plastic waste
item.description: Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính has approved a plan for Việt Nam to proactively prepare for and take part in the building of a global agreement on ocean plastic pollution.

item.title: Marine protected area to be established in Quảng Ninh Province
item.description: The Centre for Marinelife Conservation and Community Development (MCD) in collaboration with the Department of Aquatic Resources Conservation and Development of National Directorate of Fisheries and Quảng Ninh Province Sub-Department of Fisheries yesterday organised a virtual consultation meeting to present and consult on the dossier documents for establishing a Marine Protected Area (MPA) of Cô Tô – Đảo Trần.

item.title: L’Oréal and Lazada partner up to promote beauty e-commerce sustainability
item.description: During the three-month trial period in Malaysia, Thailand and Việt Nam, plastic usage was reduced by the equivalent of 180,000 high-density polyethylene (HDPE) plastic water bottles.

item.title: HCM City to build new reservoir to ensure clean water supply
item.description: HCM City plans to build a new reservoir to cope with the shortage of clean water and ensure residents' quality of life.

item.title: Locally made Agri-PV product introduced
item.description: The International Renewable Energy Expert, a local solar power cell producer, has introduced the first made-in-Việt Nam Agri-PV (Agriculture photovoltaic module) for dual-use solar energy agriculture projects in domestic and export market.

item.title: State Audit Office: Việt Nam on track to meet the Sustainable Development Goals in Mekong Delta
item.description: The audit was carried out as the region faces the unpredictable challenges of climate change, environmental degradation and unsustainable water management, which could affect the livelihood of more than 65 million people.

item.title: Two fishing boats with sailors rescued in typhoon
item.description: Eighteen sailors onboard two fishing boats from Đà Nẵng and Quảng Ngãi were safely rescued by a Coastguard ship off Lý Sơn Islands as Typhoon Conson was heading to central Việt Nam on Saturday night.

item.title: Việt Nam prepares for natural disasters amid COVID-19
item.description: Local people need to be equipped with essential skills to cope with natural disasters, especially those in the mountainous, remote and ethnic areas, as more storms and floods are expected during the rest of this year, according to the Central Steering Committee for Natural Disaster Prevention and Control.

item.title: HCM City to spend VNĐ4,500 billion for flood control
item.description: HCM City plans to allocate VNĐ4,500 billion from the city budget for 12 key irrigation projects between 2021 and 2025.

item.title: The use of pesticide in Mekong Delta remains high
item.description: The use of fertilisers and pesticides in the Mekong Delta has decreased over the years but is still higher than the national average, despite it proving to be ineffective.

item.title: US-supported project strengthens efforts to protect wildlife
item.description: The USAID Saving Species project was carried out from 2016 to 2021 at the coordination between the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) and the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development.

item.title: EU-ASEAN Business Council calls for faster action on energy transition in Southeast Asia
item.description: There is a clear need now for ASEAN to address its over-reliance on fossil fuels, particularly coal, for its energy needs, the EU-ASEAN Business Council has said.

item.title: Lý Sơn Islands at risk from quakes, volcanic eruptions
item.description: Samples of basalt and ancient rocks found on mountains and cliffs on the Lý Sơn Islands have shown that there were active volcanoes in the area less than 10,000 years ago, and researchers believe it is possible they could erupt again.

item.title: Heavy rain forecast for October, November and first half of December
item.description: Between seven and nine storms and tropical depressions are forecast to hit the East Sea, of which up to four will directly affect Việt Nam's mainland from now until the end of 2021.

item.title: Ninh Thuận to expand protection-forest cover
item.description: The south-central province of Ninh Thuận this year plans to increase its forest-cover rate to nearly 50 per cent, including 330 hectares of new special-use forest and protection-forest planted in response to climate change.

item.title: Hà Nội makes efforts to protect the city’s 'green lung'
item.description: Lê Minh Tuyên, Director of the Hà Nội Forest Protection Division under Hà Nội Agriculture and Rural Development Department, spoke to Hà Nội Mới (New Hà Nội) newspaper about difficulties and challenges in forest management and protection.

item.title: Bình Dương ensures safe COVID-19-related waste treatment
item.description: As the healthcare professionals are racing to save lives in Bình Dương, environmental workers are also on the front line to make sure COVID-19 related waste from hospitals, quarantine facilities and locked down areas is properly collected and treated to prevent risks of disease transmission in the community.

item.title: Hà Nội cleans up its pond life
item.description: Rapid urbanisation have led to increasing demand for housing and infrastructure. Consequently, ponds and lakes across the city have been filled to make room for construction.

item.title: Quảng Ninh to implement solutions for garbage crisis
item.description: Hạ Long City, a popular tourist destination in the northern coastal province of Quảng Ninh, will implement a series of measures to classify, collect, transport and treat domestic and construction waste from early next year.

item.title: Conservation group plants 2,000 trees in Đồng Nai Forest
item.description: The non-governmental organisation Gaia Nature Conservation has planted 2,000 indigenous large timber trees on four hectares in Đồng Nai Forest.

item.title: Thọ Quang fishing port begins waste water treatment
item.description: A group of bio-researchers at Đà Nẵng’s technology and education university have started a bio-based waste treatment project using water released from fishing boats at Thọ Quang dock, promising 98 per cent of pollutants will be purified

item.title: Private sector engagement key to Việt Nam's green growth
item.description: The Director of the Center for Energy and Green Growth Research Hà Đăng Sơn tallks to the Vietnam News Agency about green growth in Việt Nam, emphasizing the role of the private sector.

item.title: Monkeys cause chaos during social distancing orders on Chàm Islands
item.description: Experts from the Chàm Island Maritime Protected Area (MPA) and Hội An are looking to drive monkeys back to the forest after the animals broke into houses.

item.title: Conservation programs put on hold with access denied due to spread of COVID
item.description: Biodiversity conservation projects and forest protection in the central highlands region, over the past two years, have been either delayed or suspended as travel and mass gathering activities are limited by COVID-19 prevention measures.

item.title: Plastic waste meets its match in youth union, ethnic minority communities in Lai Châu
item.description: Responding to the movement "Against plastic waste" launched by the Youth Union of Lai Châu Province, the Youth Union of Phong Thổ District has been coordinating with the Sin Suối Hồ Commune's young people to organise the campaign "Exchange plastic waste for gifts".

item.title: Earthworm hunting impacts soil quality and ecosystem
item.description: Hunting earthworms on a large scale may severely damage the ecosystem and decrease agricultural soil quality, said environment experts.

item.title: Experts joint drafting decree to concretise environmental protection law
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment is calling for contributions to a draft Government’s decree to concretise a number of articles in the amended Law on Environmental Protection that was approved by National Assembly last November. The online newspaper Tài nguyên Môi trường (Natural Resources and Environment) introduced some experts’ opinions.

item.title: Central beach clean-up campaign launched
item.description: National footballer Phan Văn Đức will join hands with local communities and young people in the beach clean-up campaign in Hà Tĩnh, Nghệ An, Quảng Bình, Quảng Trị, Quảng Nam and Thừa Thiên Huế provinces from July to September

item.title: Scientists complete collection of sea creature specimens in southern Việt Nam
item.description: Scientists from the Institute of Oceanography under the Vietnam Academy of Science and Technology have completed a collection of more than 20,000 specimens of sea creatures, with many new creatures discovered for the first time in Vietnamese waters or entirely new species.

item.title: Erosion incidents increase in An Giang, families move to safer areas
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of An Giang is facing an increase in erosion incidents along rivers and canals as authorities try to protect households living in erosion-prone areas.

item.title: Medical, plastic wastes skyrocket in HCM City due to pandemic
item.description: The surge in plastic and coronavirus-related wastes in HCM City is creating huge pressure on its waste treatment system.

item.title: Nearly 500 wild animals illegally traded rescued this year
item.description: As many as 447 wild animals were rescued in Việt Nam in the first six months of the year, according to Education for Nature Vietnam (ENV).

item.title: Hạ Long Bay coral showing signs of recovery
item.description: The Hạ Long Bay Management Board in the northern province of Quảng Ninh is carrying various measures to protect coral reef ecosystems in the area.

item.title: Hà Nội strives to improve environment quality
item.description: Deputy Director of Hà Nội’s Department of Natural Resources and Environment, Mai Trọng Thái, talks to Hà Nội Mới (New Hà Nội) newspaper about the capital city’s environmental protection efforts.

item.title: Local community takes lead in protecting Bình Định's coral reefs
item.description: In a bid to protect coral reefs and marine ecosystems, authorities in Bình Định Province, last year, set aside four areas of coral reefs to be managed by local organisations and communities.

item.title: Cash for carbon: Quảng Nam looks to profit from reforestation efforts
item.description: Quảng Nam has asked the government to approve a plan to export 2.5 million carbon credits for an amount of VNĐ110 billion (US$4.7 million) to VNĐ130 billion ($5.6 million).

item.title: Two women fined $43,000 for involvement in illegal wildlife trade
item.description: Authorities in the Central Highlands province of Đắk Nông have fined two women more than VNĐ1 billion (US$43,584) for their involvement in the illegal wildlife trade.

item.title: Cà Mau to penalise shrimp breeders causing environmental pollution
item.description: The southernmost province of Cà Mau will fine shrimp breeders who violate regulations on dredging shrimp ponds and cause environmental pollution under a new decision to take effect on July 24.

item.title: Woman offers birds sanctuary
item.description: A woman in the northern province of Hà Tĩnh has used her home as a sanctuary for cò cói (Chinese pond heron) for the last 60 years.

item.title: Human-wildlife conflict one of the greatest threats to wildlife species: WWF and UNEP report
item.description: Conflict between people and animals, from wolves preying on cattle in Idaho, USA; to Việt Nam’s wild elephants raiding farms for food and water; to a crocodile killing hundreds of people in Burundi, is one of the main threats to the long-term survival of some of the world’s most emblematic species, a new report from WWF and the UN Environment Programme (UNEP) warned.

item.title: Google, WWF-Viet Nam join forces in Saola conservation campaign
item.description: Google joined forces with WWF-Viet Nam, to kick off the ‘Preserve the Saola’s footprints’ campaign to save this endangered species by raising awareness and calling actions from the public on World Saola Day (July9).

item.title: Illegal wildlife trade cracked down nationwide
item.description: Market Watch and legal enforcement agencies have been clearing away illegal wildlife trade at Thạnh Hóa farm produce market in the southern Long An province in responding to the call of stopping the market from 14 NGOs working in nature and wildlife conservation in Việt Nam.

item.title: Lâm Đồng farmers dig more ponds to secure irrigation water
item.description: The Tây Nguyên (Central Highlands) province of Lâm Đồng will continue providing support until 2025 to farmers who dig small ponds to store irrigation water for their crops.

item.title: Fire destroys 213ha of forest in Thừa Thiên Huế
item.description: The fire started because unexploded ordinances left from the war with America detonated due to the hot weather.

item.title: USAID partners with Đà Nẵng to accelerate renewable energy
item.description: The US Agency for International Development (USAID) and central Đà Nẵng City People’s Committee have launched a project promoting urban energy security during an online event held on Wednesday.

item.title: Central city works to ensure water security
item.description: The Đà Nẵng Water Supply company (Dawaco)’s clean water network can provide an average of 310,000 cubic metres of clean water each day, 84 per cent of the city’s total water demand, after completing upgrades in May.

item.title: HCM City plans to improve the water supply system after groundwater restriction.
item.description: HCM City is making adjustments to its Water Supply Plan to 2040, with a vision to 2060, to adapt to climate change and maintain local residents' access to clean water.

item.title: Bio-diversity protection: top priority in Đồng Tháp
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Đồng Tháp is taking measures to preserve bio-diversity in its wetlands, waterways, and dry land areas, as well as in agricultural production, in the 2021-25 period.

item.title: An Giang declares river erosion emergency
item.description: The An Giang Province People’s Committee on June 24 declared an erosion emergency in the Châu Đốc River in An Phú Town.

item.title: Performing bears handed over to sanctuary: a big step forward
item.description: The recent hand over of four bears from Hanoi’s Central Circus to a sanctuary is a big step towards helping bears in Việt Nam, said a representative of animal welfare organisation Animals Asia.

item.title: Cà Mau speeds up work on coastal embankments amid erosion threat
item.description: The southernmost province of Cà Mau is speeding up the process of building 26km of embankments along its eastern and western coasts to check erosion.

item.title: Vietnamese public support closing wildlife markets and ending deforestation
item.description: The Vietnamese public is overwhelmingly in favour of the closure of high-risk markets selling animals coming from the wild, a survey has found.

item.title: Protected zone established for endangered primates in Quảng Bình
item.description: The central province of Quang Binh has approved the establishment of a strict protection zone on 710ha of special-use forest area to protect 22 Hatinh langur herds in Đồng Hóa Commune of Tuyên Hóa District.

item.title: Securing humanity's future, one tree at a time
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has changed the world, mostly for the worse, but it could spur humanity into finally reversing the damage we have caused to the environment. Reducing CO2 emissions and planting new trees while protecting old ones are key to laying the foundations for nature to recover in the coming decade, a goal set by the United Nations.

item.title: First Vietnamese wildlife conservationist receives Goldman Environmental Prize
item.description: Nguyễn Văn Thái, 39, director of Save Vietnam's Wildlife, has becomes the first Vietnamese wildlife conservationist and the only Asian to receive the 2021 Goldman Environmental Prize - the world’s most prestigious award for grassroots environmental activists.

item.title: Việt Nam races to curb plastic waste
item.description: Nearly two years after the launch of anti-plastic waste movement, many supermarkets have committed to banning single-use plastic bags and many organisations have also had initiatives to encourage people to reduce the use of plastic.

item.title: Storm Koguma weakens into tropical depression, no damage reported
item.description: Storm Koguma, the second storm to hit Việt Nam this year, weakened into a tropical depression on Sunday after reaching the central province of Nghệ An.

item.title: Wildlife conservation NGOs call for end to wild birds trade
item.description: Representatives of 10 Vietnamese and international non-profit organisations working in nature and wildlife conservation have sent a petition to the Prime Minister to stop the trade of wild birds nationwide.

item.title: VN faces challenges in plastic waste collection, recycling
item.description: Việt Nam faces challenges in sorting, recycling and treating plastic waste and current policies for the reuse and recycling of solid waste, including plastic waste, still have shortcomings, according to experts.

item.title: Rains renew Mekong Delta erosion threat
item.description: Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta provinces and Cần Thơ have been threatened by erosion along rivers and canals in recent days, and authorities are taking measures to protect people and property.

item.title: More heatwaves on the way for north, north-central VN
item.description: Two more heatwaves are set to hit northern and north-central provinces from now until August, a top meteorologist has said.

item.title: Man handed five years imprisonment for storing 780kg of African pangolin scales
item.description: The People’s Court of northern province Hưng Yên on Wednesday sentenced a man to five years and three months in jail for storing 780kg of pangolin scales.

item.title: Việt Nam aims to shift to circular economy: minister
item.description: Việt Nam is working to shift from a linear economy to a circular economy based on the three pillars of designing and prolonging material lifespan, reducing waste and emissions, and restoring the ecological system, Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Trần Hồng Hà has said.

item.title: Việt Nam hands over rhino horn DNA samples to South Africa
item.description: The Vietnam CITES Management Authority and the Institute of Ecology and Biological Resources handed over 56 rhino horn DNA samples to the South African Embassy in Việt Nam on Tuesday.

item.title: Hà Nội, other provinces suffering extremely hot weather, high UV index
item.description: Hà Nội and other northern provinces have been witnessing extremely hot weather, with the National Centre for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting (NCHMF) predicting the current intense heat wave would last for the next 2-3 days.

item.title: Report on youth action for climate change in Việt Nam debuts
item.description: The event was co-organised by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) in Việt Nam, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE) and the Central Committee of the Hồ Chí Minh Communist Youth Union.

item.title: Kiên Giang Province focuses on growing, protecting forests
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Kiên Giang is developing mangrove forests in coastal areas and improving the livelihoods of households that protect forests.

item.title: Cần Thơ building embankments along river to prevent erosion
item.description: Cần Thơ on May 27 began construction of an erosion prevention embankment on the right bank of the Ô Môn River in Ô Môn District’s Thới An Ward.

item.title: Man goes from poacher to forest guardian
item.description: Once a hunter, he has laid down his rifle and become an active wildlife protector in Kim Bảng District in northern Hà Nam Province.

item.title: La Vie plant gets Alliance for Water Stewardship certification
item.description: The La Vie water bottling plant in Hưng Yên Province has received certification for meeting the Alliance for Water Stewardship standard, an international standard for how water should be stewarded at a site and catchment level for environment, social and economically benefit.

item.title: New green growth strategy to promote carbon-neutral economy
item.description: The Ministry of Planning and Investment is working with relevant ministries, sectors, and localities to draft a national strategy on green growth for 2021-30 and vision to 2050.

item.title: Coastal areas of Ninh Thuận polluted by waste
item.description: Coastal areas of Ninh Thuận Province are at high risk of pollution from the large amount of waste discharged in the locality.

item.title: Coordination needed between climate change adaptation and disaster risk reduction
item.description: According to meteorological experts, natural disasters are predicted to become more unpredictable and extreme due to climate change. Professor Doctor Trần Thục, former director of Institute of Hydrometeorology and Climate Change and president of Việt Nam Association of Hydrometeorology talks to Tài Nguyên và Môi Trường (Natural Resources and Environment) newspaper about this issue and the need to promote disaster risk management.

item.title: Wildlife violations reduced in Huế, Quảng Nam and Đà Nẵng
item.description: At least 86 per cent of advertisements for illegal wildlife products in hotels, restaurants, bars, pet shops and herbal medicine shops in Thừa Thiên-Huế, Đà Nẵng and Quảng Nam were removed by local authorities in 2019 and 2020.

item.title: Endangered sea turtle rescued in Quảng Nam
item.description: A female sea turtle that was rescued by a fisherman in Thăng Bình District has been handed over to rescuers of the Đà Nẵng-based SaSa Marine animals rescue team.

item.title: Huế to pilot public bike-sharing scheme
item.description: An innovative public bike-sharing scheme has been launched by Huế City, the International Co-operation Agency of Germany (GIZ) and tech firm Vietsoftpro to develop a bicycle transportation plan for 2021-2026 that mobilises private investment for bike-sharing.

item.title: Natural disaster preparedness should be long-term: minister
item.description: Disaster prevention should be a radical, long-term strategy, based on new technology such as forecasting and remote sensing to minimise damage.

item.title: Gender equality in climate action amid COVID-19
item.description: The Vietnamese Government integrated gender equality and social inclusion in its updated Nationally Determined Contribution, which was submitted to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change in September 2020.

item.title: Harmful chemical still widely used in fridges, air conditioners
item.description: A refrigerant chemical that is harmful to the environment and has ozone depletion potential is still being used in many household and industrial air conditioners and refrigerators in Việt Nam.

item.title: HCM City unveils ambitious environmental plans
item.description: The HCM City People's Committee has approved a programme to reduce environmental pollution over the next decade to improve the city's environment and enable it to adapt to climate change.

item.title: Japan assists Việt Nam in oceanographic research, oceanic plastic waste management
item.description: Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Trần Hồng Hà and Japanese Ambassador to Vietnam Takio Yamada signed a protocol in Hà Nội earlier this week regarding two non-projects on receiving an oceanographic research vessel and supporting equipment for investigating, surveying and analysing ocean plastic waste.

item.title: Human capital crucial for Việt Nam to develop renewable energy: experts
item.description: Việt Nam should pay more attention to developing skilled human resources ready for the renewable energy boom, according to experts at an event on energy transition held on Friday in Hà Nội.

item.title: Forum discusses challenges to sustainable energy transition
item.description: Việt Nam has substantial potential in offshore wind and solar power, with huge opportunities for the integration of different energy technologies and the combination of renewable energies and agriculture.

item.title: Rainy season in south to begin earlier than usual due to La Nina
item.description: The rainy season will begin two or three weeks earlier than usual in the south this year because of the La Nina phenomenon, the Southern Hydro-Meteorological Station has forecast.

item.title: New species of plants found in Lâm Đồng Province
item.description: Four new species of camellia (a genus of flowering plants in the family Theaceae) and Begonia (a genus of perennial flowering plants in the family of Begoniaceae) – have been found in Bidoup-Núi Bà National Park in Lâm Đồng Province by group of Vietnamese and international scientists and researchers.

item.title: Project to implement Paris Agreement in Việt Nam to be sped up
item.description: The Steering Committee of the project 'Support to Việt Nam for the Implementation of the Paris Agreement' (VN-SIPA) held its second meeting in Hà Nội yesterday with the participation of representatives from ministries, sectors, and localities.

item.title: Kon Hà Nừng to promote World Biosphere Reserve recognition
item.description: The central highlands Gia Lai province, in co-operation with Man and the Biosphere Programme, an intergovernmental scientific programme of UNESCO, has completed a dossier for the World Biosphere Reserve recognition of Kon Hà Nừng Highlands.

item.title: Quảng Ngãi Province shelves UNESCO geopark recognition plans
item.description: Despite having prepared a dossier for the UNESCO recognition of the Lý Sơn-Sa Huỳnh Global Geo-Park last November, local authorities have shelved plans to apply for the park's recognition after years of efforts and some 160 field surveys and scientific seminars.

item.title: Gov’t gives green light to one billion tree planting project
item.description: Of the figure, 690 million trees will be planted in urban and rural areas and 310 million in protected, special and production forests.

item.title: 2021 National Environmental Report to focus on air quality
item.description: The air quality in many localities nationwide has decreased since 2018, especially in Hà Nội and HCM City

item.title: Climate resilience scheme for urban areas approved
item.description: The scheme, which begins this year, focuses on responding to climate change and reasonable use of natural resources to upgrade and develop urban areas, as well as reducing air, water and land pollution.

item.title: Việt Nam strives to become regional pioneer in reducing ocean plastic waste
item.description: Việt Nam is striving to become a regional pioneer in reducing ocean plastic waste, heard a recent virtual meeting of environmental officials of Việt Nam, Germany, Ecuador and Ghana.

item.title: City's new water-drainage plan considers impact of rising sea levels, climate change
item.description: A plan for a new water-drainage network in HCM City has been submitted to the Prime Minister for approval.

item.title: Việt Nam aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in rice sector
item.description: Agencies in Việt Nam and international partners have been working together to seek effective measures to reduce the emission of greenhouse gases in rice production in the country.

item.title: Experts seek measures to promote Mekong Delta’s sustainable growth
item.description: Vietnamese and foreign experts and scientists gathered at a conference in Cần Thơ City on Wednesday to seek solutions to boost sustainable development in the Mekong Delta region amid climate change.

item.title: Land subsidence endangers Mekong Delta
item.description: The overexploitation of groundwater in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta has contributed to severe land subsidence, which could lead to devastating consequences if the practice continues, experts have said.

item.title: HCM City doctors warn against high UV index as hot weather set to peak
item.description: With the onset of a heat wave in HCM City, doctors are urging people to take preventive measures against heat-related health conditions.

item.title: Coral population remains well protected off Chàm Island
item.description: Coral reefs off Chàm Island have been well conserved with an average coverage of 59.16 per cent at seven sites following an annual reef check and coral clean-up programme.

item.title: Actions needed to combat illegal trade of ivory and wildlife in Việt Nam: WWF
item.description: A survey of nearly 600 Chinese tourists who visited Việt Nam showed that 17 per cent of them visited ivory shops during their visit and an estimation 2 per cent bought ivory products with an average spending of VNĐ12 million (US$522).

item.title: Death of sưa trees in Hà Nội sparks public concern
item.description: Sưa trees are commonly found along Hà Nội’s streets. The tree is ranked as vulnerable on the International Union for the Conservation of Nature’s Red List of Endangered Species. In Việt Nam, sưa wood is highly valued for its quality.

item.title: Wildlife Rescue Centre the second home of animals
item.description: The Wildlife Rescue Centre, at U Minh Thượng National Park, in the southern province of Kiên Giang, has rescued hundreds of animals over the years and saved the lives of many rare wildlife species.

item.title: More solutions needed to revive rivers: Expert
item.description: Đào Trọng Tứ, head co-ordinator of the Việt Nam River Network (VRN), speaks to the Vietnam News Agency about finding solutions to revive rivers

item.title: Saltwater intrusion to affect crops in Mekong Delta, farmers take preventive measures
item.description: Saltwater intrusion will affect about 40,000ha of fruits and 5,000ha of rice in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta this month, according to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development’s Irrigation Department.

item.title: Waste reduced at wholesale markets as HCM City insists on processing before transport
item.description: The volume of waste relative to the total agricultural produce reaching focal points in HCM City has tended to decrease thanks to partial processing at source, according to the city people’s committee.

item.title: Japan supports Việt Nam in building regulations on waste management
item.description: Cooperation in waste management and the building of emission-free circular economy was highlighted at the third meeting of the Joint Committee of Việt Nam’s Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MoNRE) and Japan’s Ministry of the Environment on Wednesday.

item.title: Sơn Trà peninsula begins ‘One Million Trees Plantation’
item.description: The central city of Đà Nẵng, in co-operation with the NGO GreenViet, has launched the ‘One Million Trees Plantation’ project in public parks and pedestrian zones in Sơn Trà District to provide a ‘green’ shadow for the community and reduce air pollution.

item.title: Word Bank, Green Climate Fund provide Việt Nam with $86.3 million to spur energy efficiency investments
item.description: The World Bank, acting on behalf of the Green Climate Fund (GCF), has signed a grant worth US$11.3 million with the State Bank of Viet Nam to support the development of a commercial financing market for industrial energy efficiency investments.

item.title: Plastic bags and products still plague Ha Noi
item.description: Plastic bags and products are selling in large quantities in local markets because they are not only cheap but also convenient.

item.title: Đà Nẵng City urges protection of endangered primate population
item.description: Director of GreenViet, Trần Hữu Vỹ, said the research, which began last December, has been tracking the habitat and population of the monkeys as well as food chains to limit risks of conflict with human activities.

item.title: Char coal stoves must be eliminated
item.description: Lê Thanh Thuỷ, head of the Bureau for Project Management and Communication under the Hà Nội Department of Natural Resources and Environment talks to the newspaper Tài Nguyên và Môi trường (Natural Resources and Environment) on Hà Nội’s determination to end the use of charcoal stoves

item.title: Poor air quality forecast between March 1-6 in the north
item.description: The air quality between March 1 and 6 in north-eastern localities and the Hồng (Red) River delta as well as Thanh Hoá Province is forecast to be poor.

item.title: Innovations to implement Việt Nam’s climate change targets
item.description: Youth Union members and young people, as Việt Nam's future leaders, play an important role to implement the Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) targets, said Phạm Văn Tấn, Deputy Director-General of the Department of Climate Change under the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE).

enclosure.url: https://image.vietnamnews.vn/uploadvnnews/Article/2021/2/26/139512_Bà CAITLIN WIESEN - Trưởng đại diện UNDP tại Việt Nam - Phát biểu khai mạc.jpg

item.title: Gia Lai rapidly expands forest cover
item.description: The Tây Nguyên (Central Highlands) province of Gia Lai has been growing new forests and protecting existing ones in recent years to expand forest cover and improve people’s livelihoods.

item.title: Zero waste systems could create more than 18,000 jobs in HCM City
item.description: The Global Alliance for Incinerator Alternatives (GAIA) said its new study shows that cities that invest in zero waste programmes and policies create numerous, good and green jobs, in addition to known benefits like reducing pollution and improving community health.

item.title: Việt Nam actively contributes to ASEAN environmental cooperation
item.description: Việt Nam will actively join activities of the ASEAN Working Group on Climate Change (AWGCC), as well as continue its coordinating role in performing relevant activities in 2021, according to the ASEAN Senior Officials on the Environment (ASOEN)’s office in Việt Nam (ASOEN Vietnam Office).

item.title: Mekong Delta saves winter-spring crop from drought, saltwater intrusion
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta has protected its winter-spring crops from saltwater intrusion and drought by taking preventive measures in the ongoing dry season.

item.title: VN aims to plant a billion trees by 2025
item.description: About 690 million trees will be planted in urban and rural areas, and 310 million in forests.

item.title: HCM City's major environment and sanitation project face slow progress
item.description: A project to improve the environment and sanitation in HCM City’s District 2 worth more than VNĐ11.13 trillion (US$495 million) is lagging well behind schedule, requiring authorities’ interventions to speed up.

item.title: Lecturer encourages young people to live green
item.description: Lê Minh Tân, a lecturer of Vinh University, central Nghệ An Province, not only follows a green-living lifestyle but also encourages people around him to take a leaf out of his book and follow in his footsteps.

item.title: Live greener day by day
item.description: A group of young people are helping each other to live a greener lifestyle, and hope their actions will spread into the wider community.

item.title: Over 1,130 wild animals rescued in Việt Nam in 2020
