item.description: As many as 1,132 wild animals were successfully rescued in Việt Nam last year, according to the Education for Nature Vietnam (ENV).

item.title: Young people join hands to keep Central Highlands green
item.description: Tree-planting projects to protect the environment have become increasingly popular among young people from HCM City.

item.title: Việt Nam responds to World Wetlands Day
item.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE) has asked other ministries, agencies and localities to take action in response to World Wetlands Day (February 2).

item.title: US shares experiences in environmental management
item.description: Air quality in the capital city fell to dangerous levels in the first week of the New Year, particularly in inner city areas, according to the Department of Natural Resources and Environment.

item.title: Việt Nam vows to strengthen climate adaptation efforts, needs US$35 billion this decade
item.description: Prime Minister Nguyễn Xuân Phúc has delivered an important message to the Climate Adaptation Summit which took place virtually on January 25 and 26.

item.title: Cor ethnic people dedicated to protecting the forest
item.description: Located 1,400m above sea level, Cà Đam mountain in Trà Bồng District, Quảng Ngãi Province is home to many rare and precious herbs, plants and animals.

item.title: Trà Vinh to dredge irrigation canals to better cope with dry season
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Trà Vinh will dredge its 18 main irrigation canals that run a total of 162 km in the next four years at a cost of VNĐ387 billion (US$16.7 million) to improve the supply of water for irrigation during dry seasons.

item.title: PM orders intensifying air quality control measures
item.description: Prime Minister Nguyễn Xuân Phúc has asked ministries and People’s Committees of centrally-run cities and provinces to step up the implementation of programmes and tasks to improve air quality control.

item.title: New partnership to reduce greenhouse gas in building
item.description: The German Development Co-operation-GIZ Việt Nam and the Ministry of Construction’s Housing and Real Estate Market Management Bureau (HREM) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for co-operation on the joint development of the Vietnam Green Housing Programme (VGHP) under the implementation of the Programme for Energy Efficiency in Buildings (PEEB) in Việt Nam.

item.title: Forest worker inspires people to love the wild
item.description: Nguyễn Tấn Truyền is among those working in Vồ Dơi National Park in southern Cà Mau Province’s U Minh District, who are trained to understand the value of primeval forests for human life on Earth.

item.title: Environmental polluter becomes protector
item.description: While the whole world continues to battle rising environmental pollution, one group of Vietnamese students has found a radical solution from cashew nut shells and wild sunflower leaves to bring to the fight.

item.title: Mekong Delta ensures water supply as saltwater intrusion to be at above-average levels in dry season
item.description: Saltwater intrusion in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta in the 2020 – 21 dry season is expected to be higher than average, but not as severe as the last dry season.

item.title: Plastic pollution in coastal area: reported
item.description: Microplastics contamination at beaches, lakes and channels in the central city reached serious levels with100 plastic items found in one cubic metre – up to five times higher than the average microplastic contaminated sites in the world.

item.title: Hà Nội to inspect firm after environmental workers strike
item.description: The Hà Nội’s People’s Committee has sent a team of inspectors to investigate the operation of Minh Quân High Technology Development and Investment JSC following a recent environmental workers’ strike.

item.title: Central province promotes Sông Thanh National Park
item.description: The central province has promoted the Sông Thanh Nature Reserve as a National Park for the conservation of its rich biodiversity covering nearly 77,000 hectares, of which more than 58,000 was tropical, evergreen primary forest in districts of Nam Giang and Phước Sơn.

item.title: Ministry asked to speed up green growth criteria
item.description: The environment minister Trần Hồng Hà said 2020 was a difficult year for Việt Nam as it suffered serious damage from COVID-19 and natural disasters.

item.title: Audit focuses on identifying responsibilities of countries in Mekong River area
item.description: Member of the Party Central Committee, State Auditor General Hồ Đức Phớc talks to the Vietnam News Agency about the plan to audit water resources in the Mekong River basin

item.title: HCM City to save 2 percent power by 2025
item.description: HCM City has set a target to save at least 2 per cent of total energy consumption each year in the 2021-2025 period.

item.title: Long An begins to crack down on pollution of canals
item.description: The Long An Province People’s Committee has ordered relevant agencies and Đức Hòa District to improve oversight of pollution, especially around industrial parks and industrial clusters, to resolve the problem of the worsening state of canals in the district.

item.title: Long An to build new anti-landslide embankment
item.description: A new 1.2km-long embankment worth VNĐ300 billion (US$12.9 million) will be built to prevent landslides along Vàm Cỏ Tây River in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Long An next year.

item.title: Rice farmers benefit from emissions reduction programme
item.description: Thousands of rice farmers in the northern province of Thái Bình are benefiting from a programme meant to help them adopt innovative technologies and approaches to increase yields while reducing greenhouse gas emissions, a meeting heard in HCM City on December 25.

item.title: Travel agencies pledge to protect Việt Nam’s wildlife
item.description: Representatives from 30 tour operators and travel agencies recently signed a pledge to support responsible tourism, nature conservation and wildlife protection during a training workshop at Cát Tiên National Park in the southern province of Dong Nai.

item.title: Panasonic Appliances Vietnam honoured for most energy efficient products
item.description: Panasonic Appliances Vietnam has received the Most Energy Efficient Products 2020 award, organised by the Ministry of Industry and Trade, for its energy-saving and environment-friendly household electronic products.

item.title: Young man starts initiative to reduce plastic waste
item.description: Phạm Thanh Trí from Quảng Ngãi founded EcoFish Vietnam to teach young people to classify and reuse plastic waste.

item.title: Thanh Hóa farmer protects wild birds with his love
item.description: He divided the land into three areas, with two for breeding cattle and growing fruit trees, and the other as a shelter for the storks and many other types of creatures.

item.title: Seminar talks facilitating green growth
item.description: A seminar was held in Hà Nội on Tuesday to discuss research on incorporating goals of the national action plan implementing the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and national strategy on green growth into socio-economic development plans of centrally-run cities and provinces.

item.title: Cold spell hits northern Việt Nam
item.description: A strong cold spell has hit the northern region of Việt Nam, bringing rain and lowering temperatures.

item.title: La Vie launches mineral water in recycled plastic bottles
item.description: La Vie , a subsidiary of Nestlé Group, has launched natural mineral water using recycled plastic bottles.

item.title: Trà Vinh households plant forests to prevent coastal erosion, earn money
item.description: Households in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Trà Vinh have been planting protective forests in coastal areas to prevent erosion and earn a living for a number of years.

item.title: Cửu Long Delta expected to become energy hub, to supply other regions
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta is expected to become an energy export hub in 2021-30 under a plan drawn up by the Ministry of Planning and Investment.

item.title: Wild bird hunting and poaching rampant on Cát Bà Island
item.description: Local people have long been reportedly involved in illegal wild bird hunting and poaching in Cát Bà Island of the northern city of Hải Phòng and local authorities have failed to curb the problem for decades.

item.title: Chàm Islands take action on plastic waste
item.description: The ancient town of Hội An, in co-operation with UNESCO, has launched the 2020 Plastic Action Day, boosting drastic activities in protecting the ocean and saying ‘No’ to single-use plastic products.

item.title: Construction waste should be recycled: experts
item.description: As many as 37,000 tonnes of solid waste is generated daily in urban areas, according to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE).

item.title: Technology transformation needed for cleaner production
item.description: Despite 50 per cent of businesses applying the resource efficient and cleaner production (RECP), savings of fuel and energy consumption per product only achieved a ratio of eight to 13 per cent in 2016-20.

item.title: Central region hit by heavy rains, flooding
item.description: Prolonged heavy rains during the past three days have caused serious flooding and landslides in parts of central Viet Nam and the Central Highlands, leaving at least one person missing.

item.title: Việt Nam promotes conservation and protection of wetlands
item.description: The establishment of two new wetland protected areas (WPAs) – Thái Thụy WPA in the northern Thái Bình Province and Tam Giang-Cầu Hai WPA in the central Thừa Thiên-Huế Province, were seen as positive major outcomes of the ‘Conservation of Critical Wetland Protected Areas and Linked Landscapes’ project in 2015-20.

item.title: Thousands of wildlife farms in Việt Nam threaten biodiversity
item.description: In recent decades, along with the robust development of the economy, the demand for wildlife in Việt Nam, especially in big cities, has increased.

item.title: Seminar discusses solutions to improve indoor air quality in urban areas
item.description: Experts discussed measures to improve indoor air quality in urban houses in efforts to tackle environmental pollution at an international seminar in Hà Nội on Saturday.

item.title: HCM City to improve solutions to climate change response
item.description: HCM City will assess the relationship between the factors that cause climate change and its socio-economic plans to develop long-term responses.

item.title: Trà Vinh steps up measures to cope with severe saltwater intrusion forecast in dry season
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Trà Vinh has taken a number of measures to prevent saltwater intrusion up rivers and canals in the upcoming dry season to ensure there is no shortage of water for irrigation and household use.

item.title: Southern island launches zero plastic waste programme
item.description: Local authorities of Côn Đảo Island district, off the coast of southern Bà Rịa-Vũng Tàu Province, in co-operation with the World Wildlife Fund for Nature (WWF), launched a Zero Plastic Waste programme, aiming to eliminate single-use plastic products.

item.title: Senior ASEAN officials meet to discuss environmental issues
item.description: The 31st Meeting of ASEAN Senior Officials on the Environment (ASOEN 31) and related meetings have begun via videoconference to discuss environmental sustainability.

item.title: Hà Nội aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions
item.description: Hà Nội will strive to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 15 per cent by 2030, according to local authorities.

item.title: Cà Mau Province suffers $46m losses from natural disasters in 2020
item.description: Natural disasters have caused losses worth VNĐ1.06 trillion (US$46 million) in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta province of Cà Mau this year, destroying public infrastructure, houses and crops, according to the local Steering Committee for Natural Disaster Prevention and Control, Search and Rescue.

item.title: Ministry rejects three land conversion proposals
item.description: The projects include limestone exploitation in Ninh Bình, the Hòa Thắng 1.2 wind power project in Bình Thuận, and building roads to the Ngọc Linh Ginseng production area in Nam Trà My District, Quảng Nam Province.

item.title: Dialogue discusses strengthening wildlife legislation and communication in Việt Nam
item.description: Strengthening legislation and communication about wildlife protection was the main topic of a discussion held in Hà Nội on Friday.

item.title: Revised law focuses on keeping the environment clean
item.description: Minister of Environment Trần Hồng Hà talks to BNEWS about Việt Nam’s efforts to protect the environment, particularly air and water.

item.title: 20 years since Việt Nam joined World Biosphere Reserve network
item.description: As most of the protected areas and biosphere reserves in Việt Nam are located in areas with high poverty rates, achieving the goal of both conservation and economic development is difficult.

item.title: Việt Nam should apply more technologies in plastic waste recycling
item.description: Vice chairman and the General Secretary of the Vietnam Responsible Care Council Đỗ Thanh Bái spoke with Tài nguyên & Môi trường (Natural Resources and Environment) newspaper about the plastic waste recycling and technologies to solve plastic waste in Việt Nam.

item.title: VN’s updated climate goals aim at maximising the co-benefits of climate action
item.description: Việt Nam has recently incorporated a new section into its updated Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) to emphasise the socio-economic co-benefits of climate action for the country.

item.title: Plastic waste recycling needs improvement to prevent pollution
item.description: Nguyễn Thị Hưởng, Head of the Hà Nội Sub-department of Natural Resources and Environment's Environment Assessment talks to the Tài nguyên & Môi trường (Natural Resources and Environment) online newspaper on how to make traditional plastic waste recycling craft villages become cleaner and greener.

item.title: Deputy PM orders central localities to prepare for storm
item.description: Central localities have been told to urgently remedy the consequences of Storm Etau and continue preparing for Storm Vamco.

item.title: UNDP supports disaster-affected people in central Việt Nam
item.description: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) handed over gender-responsive household kits, disinfectants, and equipment for storm and flood monitoring and assessment to people suffering from floods in central Việt Nam.

item.title: Environment ministry seeks to complete regulations on solid waste management
item.description: Measures must be crafted to replace disposable plastic bags with eco-friendly ones at shopping malls and supermarkets by 2026.

item.title: Environmental protection must be at the core of socio-economic development targets
item.description: Predictions on the intensity and impacts of environmental issues on various aspects of socio-economy must be highlighted in the draft documents submitted to the 13th Party Congress, said deputy head of the Vietnam Environment Administration (VEA) Nguyễn Hưng Thịnh.

item.title: Hà Nội chairman urges local agencies to solve issues of Sóc Sơn landfill
item.description: Collecting, transporting and treating waste in Hà Nội must be comprehensively handled to ensure hygiene for people and the environment in the areas surrounding Nam Sơn Waste Treatment Complex in Sóc Sơn District, said Hà Nội People’s Committee Chairman Chu Ngọc Anh.

item.title: Heavy rains hit central provinces, another storm to come
item.description: The tropical low-pressure system which Storm Goni weakened into on Thursday afternoon turned into a low-pressure system on Friday morning when approaching the coasts of central provinces from Quảng Ngãi to Phú Yên, as yet another storm bore down on the country.

item.title: Long An, Bình Thuận begin waste classification at source
item.description: All households, agencies and businesses living in Ward 3 of Tân An city in the southern province began sorting out their waste before it is collected from Thursday

item.title: Storms, floods cause economic loss of over $730 million: Gov’t report
item.description: The true cost of the storms that hit central Việt Nam has emerged with 235 people dead or missing and an estimated economic loss of VNĐ17 trillion (US$733.4 million).

item.title: Asiatic black bears handed over to rescue centre
item.description: Two endangered Asiatic black bears were handed over to Vietnam Bear Rescue Centre in the northern province of Vinh Phuc on Tuesday after years of being caged by a resident in Phu Tho Province.

item.title: More efforts needed for forest protection: expert
item.description: Việt Nam has abundant forest resources, but there are many ongoing problems relating to forest protection. Triệu Văn Hùng, Chairman of the Viet Nam Forest Science Technology Association, talks to Viettimes about the issue

item.title: Storm Goni heading to central provinces from Quảng Ngãi to Khánh Hòa
item.description: Đà Nẵng City and Quảng Nam Province might not be directedly hit by Storm Goni as the storm is expected to make landfall in central provinces from Quảng Ngãi to Khánh Hòa on Thursday, according to the National Centre for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting.

item.title: Mekong Delta localities plant trees, build natural embankments to prevent erosion
item.description: More people in the Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta are planting trees and building embankments made of natural materials to prevent erosion along rivers and canals.

item.title: Storm Molave continues to impact central provinces
item.description: Storm Molave, which has killed at least 24 people in central coastal provinces in recent days according to disaster agencies, flooded many localities in Nghệ An Province on Friday.

item.title: Three Bình Định fishermen rescued at sea, 23 still missing
item.description: Three Vietnamese fishermen have been pulled from the ocean after they were spotted by a passing cargo ship.

item.title: Central region begins repairing post-storm damage
item.description: Local disaster agencies in the region said 12 fishing boats were sunken during the storm that ravaged the region from early morning till late evening.

item.title: Land erosion worsens in the Mekong Delta
item.description: The damage caused by landslides in the Mekong Delta provinces has been increasing yearly.

item.title: Central region battens down the hatches
item.description: Residents have been instructed to leave temporary housing in the central provinces of Thừa Thiên-Huế, Quảng Nam, Quảng Ngãi and Đà Nẵng before 5pm on October 27 before Storm Molave makes landfall on Wednesday.

item.title: Central province restores landscape and forest of Mỹ Sơn Sanctuary
item.description: Authorities of the central province of Quang Nam have approved the protection and biodiversity restoration project on the Mỹ Sơn historical and cultural scenery site with a total investment of VNĐ96 billion (US$4.2 million) in 2020-25.

item.title: Việt Nam, WB sign emissions reduction purchase agreement
item.description: Carolyn Turk, WB Country Director in Việt Nam, said this is a results-based payment and the basic indicators underpinning it are to reduce greenhouse gases in the provinces.

item.title: Cà Mau declares emergency as western sea dyke is badly eroded
item.description: The Cà Mau Province People’s Committee on October 21 declared an emergency after discovering a total of 5.8km of the 108km western sea dyke in U Minh and Trần Văn Thời districts dangerously eroded.

item.title: Students, enterprises work to reduce plastic waste in VN
item.description: Nguyễn Thị Ngọc, a student at Hà Nội University of Science and Technology and a member of the Green Eye Group in the Youth for Environment Project, has proposed that customers should be allowed to take their used milk cartons or bottles and electronic devices to stores where they initially bought them and receive a discount for future purchases.

item.title: Weather forecasting centre rejects fake news about super typhoon
item.description: The National Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting Centre has rejected reports alleging the eighth storm to hit central region of Việt Nam, known as Saudel, is actually a super typhoon.

item.title: Nation donates to residents of flood-hit central region
item.description: Prime Minister Nguyễn Xuân Phúc yesterday ordered the Ministry of Finance to allocate 5,000 tonnes of rice from the national reserves to the flood-hit provinces of Quảng Bình, Quảng Trị, Thừa Thiên Huế and Quảng Nam.

item.title: Tây Ninh releases fish fry into reservoir to regenerate fishery resources
item.description: The southern province of Tây Ninh on Thursday (October 15) began releasing more than 515,000 fry of various fish species into the Dầu Tiếng Reservoir to regenerate fishery resources during the ongoing rainy season.

item.title: Despite campaign, Hà Nội’s markets still flooded with plastic waste
item.description: It has been more than a year since the fight against plastic waste was launched on a national scale and despite claims of success by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, VietnamPlus reporters have observed that single-use plastic is still commonly used at markets and supermarkets in Ha Noi.

item.title: Soldiers missing amid attempt to rescue workers trapped by landslide
item.description: Authorities lost contact with 13 members of the rescue team late on Monday night, while some members have returned safely to the rescue base.

item.title: Typhoon to make landfall in north on Wednesday
item.description: Typhoon Nangka, the seventh to form in the East Sea this year, has been forecast to make landfall in northern and north-central regions on Wednesday afternoon, bringing torrential rain and high risk of flooding and severe landslides.

item.title: HCM City expands 'green school' model
item.description: HCM City is expanding the "green school model" at all educational levels as part of its effort to raise awareness about environmental protection through energy saving, recycling, and waste separation at source.

item.title: ADB and Phú Yên sign Việt Nam’s first certified green loan for 257 MW solar power project
item.description: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) and Phú Yên TTP Joint Stock Company (Phú Yên JSC) on Friday signed a US$186 million loan to develop and operate a 257 megawatt (MW) solar power plant in the southern province of Phú Yên’s Hòa Hội, through the country’s first certified green loan.

item.title: Seven crewmen from drifting vessels saved at sea
item.description: Five sailors were rescued from the sea after their boat sank late Thursday off the coast of Quảng Trị province.

item.title: Flood-hit areas evacuated in Hoi An
item.description: Houses and restaurants along the Hoài River in Hội An were evacuated on Thursday afternoon after floodwater breached many buildings following three days of uninterrupted rain.

item.title: Central provinces told to prepare for dangerous weather
item.description: The central region is forecast to experience prolonged heavy rains and floods in the coming days due to a low-pressure system in the East Sea that may grow into a tropical depression.

item.title: Wildlife products widely sold in Viet Nam, despite legal measures
item.description: Although the law prohibits any possession or sale of ivory items, jewellery made from these wild animals is widely available across the country, both in physical stores and online.

item.title: Cần Thơ to lengthen under-construction embankment as more riverbank erodes
item.description: The Cửu Long (Mekong) Delta city of Cần Thơ will build an additional 30-metre stretch of embankment at a site of erosion along the Trà Nóc River in Bình Thủy District.
